Reviews.Title: “Stylish and Value-for-Money”
Reviews.Author: Lone G
Reviews.Content: For Easter 2012 I had bought a package trip from Denmark for my daughter (21) and me. All expectations were fully met: Wonderful hotel, delicious and well assorted morning buffet, sophisticated 3-course meal at 'a Choice', clean Italian food at 'Oscar's' - the two restaurants at the hotel. Very nice back massage and spa. Spectacular Sky Lounge. Dvds borrowed for free. Nice and helpful staff. Peaceful nights in very good beds. Tram M5 just outside and 5-7 minutes from Alexander Platz. Can recommend Andel's Hotel wholeheartedly. I will return, next time with my husband!

Reviews.Title: “Andel's revisited: still excellent”
Reviews.Author: Oscar_from_Denmark
Reviews.Content: I stayed 3 nights this time at the Andel's hotel. My last visit there was a success and this time the experience was equally great. The only minus is the location but S bahn 5 and 6 will take you to Alexanderplatz and they stop almost at the door very often. So, at the end, this is not a big issue in my humble opinion. The rooms are stylish and perfectly clean. The hotel offer free wifi access and there is a wellness centre that I didn't visit. The breakfast is excellent. The staff is very polite and helpful. An excellent hotel, maybe the best one I ever stayed at... Good luck!

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Rammstein Tour in Berlin with Andel's Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Jensajenerator
Reviews.Content: This was base for a 3 day rammstein at velodrome november 2011 and again 2 times during summer 2010 & agoust 2011 on the way to Iceland. Great little hotel with among the friendliest staff I have ever met. Room was nice and clean. Large bathroom but it had a tub! There were some very personal touches that went a long way. Andel's is one of the best hotel not far away from Alexander platz, Large Breakfast, Full Service in Rooms, Sky Bar is awesome when its about drink & Eat! Best 5 stars hotel thats for sure! First Choice when i go to Berlin!

Reviews.Title: “very good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RolandToth
Reviews.Content: HI, I was in this hotel 6 nights. this is a good hotel for Messe. The location is not very nice, but with S BAHN you can reach the city center in 10 minuts. from Alexanderplatz with Taxi costs about 14 EUR. I booked this hotel with booking.com for a great price about 109 EUR for doubleroom with breakfest. The breakfast was very good too. NIce rooms, book on higher. i would come back again. ps: there is a nice spa area too.

Reviews.Title: “Prima!”
Reviews.Author: Julia0506
Reviews.Content: The hotel exceed all my expectations. Many thanks to Juliana Luettich and her team. Great place for a couple of drinks about a 3 minute walk is a local bar called Libero. Exit the hotel main entrance, turn right and cross at the lights. Take the next street off to the right called Karl-Lade-Strasse and the bar is a few metres on the right. On the Museum Island directly opposite the main entrance to the Pergamon Museum is a fantastic place to eat. It is called Pergamonkeller and the food is delicious, good value for money and the atmosphere is great.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Siobhan_LDN
Reviews.Content: When we first arrived at the hotel I was a bit taken aback by the location, on the crossroads of a very busy road, a little way out of town, but overall, our stay at the hotel was very good. The S Bahn trains weren't running when we visited, but it didn't take long to get to Alexanderplatz via the tram. We liked the room, and the bathroom was particularly impressive. The staff were really helpful and accommodated a number of our requests such as asking for a adapter to borrow and for taxis to be booked. The best thing was the breakfast buffet each morning, which offered a really wide range of good food. The bar on the 14th floor is not cheap, but worth visiting to admire the views across the city.

Reviews.Title: “excellent breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Dudi_Saar
Reviews.Content: the hotel is very recommended. not in the center but "on" the metro station.Direct line from the airport.very modern rooms .the best thing was the rich breakfasf. plenty of choices.after breakfast you could not eat until evening...very recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel Pity About the Location”
Reviews.Author: Dirk49
Reviews.Content: This is a modern, stylish and spacious hotel with excellent facilties and a friendly staff BUT it is deep inside the former East Berlin, surrounded by communist era high rise flats. You have to use public transport to get to see anything of note. Fortunately there is a tram stop and an S Bahn station close by. We found, however, that travelling on the tram was often a crowded and unpleasant experience. Much alcohol was consumed on the trams at all times of day and we frequently encountered gangs of drunken youths both here and in the S & U Bahn systems. We may have been unlucky with our room but we did experience a succession of problems - in-room safe not working, T.V. remote worked sporadically, card slot to switch on the power kept falling off the wall, room fridge not working. All were reported by us, in some cases several times, but none were satisfactorily resolved before we checked out. As for Berlin itself - it will confound all your presumptions about Germany and Germans - it is dirty, the people can be quite rude and the service in restaurants etc is not particularly efficient BUT despite all this it is still worth visiting for its history, culture and incredible energy.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: scootertrash8
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a conference. It is a great hotel w/an amazing staff. The hotel is definitely a distance from the core of Berlin. But, the S-bahn station nearby makes easy to get where needed very quickly. Restaurants in the area are limited, but, the are a couple. Also, there is a grocery store about a 15 minute walk. The consierge was very helpful in understanding the use of the public transportation(it is really easy), all passes needed for it, &, making arrangements for my departure. I would definitely recommend this hotel. Don't let the location discourage you.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with good price offers!”
Reviews.Author: Annabel o
Reviews.Content: Trendy designed rooms/hotel. We had a nice walk in shower and really liked the style of the room. Most tour operators have really good offers for this hotel. We didn't like the food in the restaurant. The food doesn't match with trendy atmosphere. But there are enough lovely restaurants in the neighborhood and it's easy to get around, the tramstop is in front of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: ““Excellent service, clean and safe””
Reviews.Author: bestundfest
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Andel's Hotel for four days in March 2012. I can say that the service is excellent, the room has a wonderful bed. Our short stay at the hotel was everything we had wished for. The rooms are fresh, clean and tastefully decorated, the staff extremely friendly and the position of the hotel in Berlin is perfect. Breakfasts and meals were of high quality and well served. But it's just for western people.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel-great break”
Reviews.Author: jellybaby12344
Reviews.Content: We have just arrived back from weekend in Berlin(6 women). lovely stay the hotel and all rooms spotless,lack of clothes storage would be an issue if staying longer than 3 nights ,reception staff helpful and friendly,breakfast superb.Although located 10 mins by tram from Alexanderplatz ,the M5 stops right outside hotel and runs every few minutes,the train station is literally a few yards from the hotel and the S9 takes you to and from the airport running every half hour.We did have a problem getting to the hotel as we arrived on a Saturday and the S9 was not running,but people were helpful and directed us to the correct trains. We found 2 very nice places to eat opposite the hotel an Italian and a lovely Mexican restaurant very reasonable prices and large cocktails 4 euros each all night ,Would not recommend a weekend but a midweek break due to the train problems and also very busy for getting on hop on hop off buses which stopped running at 3pm on Sundays, and shops all closed ,we wanted to visit the large famous department store that day ,so plans needed rearranging.Welcome card 26 euros a must ,good value .Hop on bus 16 euros for 2 days with the card discount and river spree trip(1 hr-- 8 euros) gave a prettier perspective of Berlin. A 3 night break is not enough time to explore this city properly .

Reviews.Title: “Far better than expected”
Reviews.Author: yaserkangani
Reviews.Content: I was reading reviews before making my booking for this hotel, I was not sure if I should expect a good quality specially as rate was so attractive. However I arrived and I really impressed with great and hospitable staff, nice and convenient location of the hotel, spacious room and nice amenities and excellent quality of food in restaurants of the hotel, I can confidently say It was one of the best 4 star properties I have ever stayed in Europe. I strongly recommend this hotel for any purpose of stay, leisure or a business trip, this place is fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient stay in Andel's”
Reviews.Author: 10En
Reviews.Content: This is a very big hotel in Friedrichshain in Berlin. Not the best location, but the subway is around the corner, so you can be were you want to be very fast. Breakfast is really, really great, something for everybody. The rooms are very clean and lovely. The showerhead was broken in our room, we fixed it with a towel. when we came back at the end of the day they took the towel away and didn't do nothing about it. We forgot to mention this to the reception, so this was partly our fault, but with the towel hanging on such a strange place in the bathroom i'm pretty sure they noticed it, but ignored it. Anyway, we loved our stay here and would come back!

Reviews.Title: “Not recommended for a family leisure stays.”
Reviews.Author: aubin785
Reviews.Content: A huge buisness hotel 4 km from Alexanderplatz. (An S bahn & Tram outside). Would not recommend this as a place for families but good for buisiness stays & that was evident. Be aware that when you book a superior room this is the standard & that although the hotel advertises triple rooms it does not have triple or family rooms & so will just put in another bed. This means in the standard/superior room you will barely be able to walk around in the room & will need to take turns getting dressed! We were upgraded to a deluxe room which was perfect but may cost considerably more. The bathroom & beds were great. The breakfast was superb with choices including everything you could want.The sky bar was busy & beautiful.Lovely spa /sauna area (but, shy Brits, be aware that it is mixed & no clothes!) Overall, a smart clean & comfortable buisness hotel on the outskirts of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel!”
Reviews.Author: smudge1105
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel! Had a wonderful room. The facilities were great, sauna, massages etc. Breakfast was included and it was delicious. Very easy to get into the centre of Berlin. The bar at the top of the hotel serves great nibbles and brilliant cocktails. No complaints at all! Do the segway tour. Fantastic fun and lots of culture!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent quality, just a little out of the way...”
Reviews.Author: MaggietheMoocher
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my daughter for a short trip to Berlin. We felt slightly intimidated at first as it is such a big hotel with an enormous lobby, and it seems more geared up for business conferences than tourists. Having said that, we soon felt at home. Everything was very clean and tidy, breakfast is comprehensive and the staff were always helpful. My only complaint was that there wasn't much wardrobe space for both of us and I had to live out of my bag a bit. The bed, however, was the most comfortable I have slept in for a long time, the curtains kept the room dark and we slept really well till quite late! The S Bahn station is right outside, as is the tram line that goes to Alexanderplatz. If you are arriving from Schonefeld airport, you can walk from the airport to the train station then take the S Bahn line 9 which passes directly by the hotel - get your ticket from the machine in the station (which will have instructions in english), you will need Berlin ABC, and don't forget (as we did!) to validate your ticket in one of the little machines that prints the time and date. At Landsberger Allee walk to the far end of the exit and those steps will bring you out right by the hotel doorway! As other reviewers have said, it is in the east of Berlin and there is very little within walking distance but the trams and S Bahn run regularly - ask reception for help in which transport card/tickets to buy and also for maps. We got our rooms as a last minute deal and so it was good value for us, especially as other hotels I looked at did not provide breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: MrnMrsJohns
Reviews.Content: A good location for the city centre, breakfeast is very good also. I will defo stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Hotel, Little Far from the Touristy Sights”
Reviews.Author: Aussie B
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights in mid feb 2012. It is a great hotel and the staff are great. Sky bar is great, the spa and sauna are great. so are the free computers in the lobby. we borrowed dvds for free and that was great. we had a problem with the heating one night and then when i informed the reception they sent someone up to fix it within the hour. so that was great also. the breakfast is fantastic and the free newspapers are great. The only problem we had was that there were a lot of hairs, lint, etc on our sheets and pillows. Whoever is doing the washing/drying needs to clean out the filters on their dryers. My partner expressed displeasure about this on the first night however it didnt change. Location-wise, YOU ARE IN EAST BERLIN. so if you want to be closer to the main attractions this probably isnt that spot for you. Also, there are a lot of homosexuals in this hotel. it is 'gay friendly.' so if you feel uncomfortable about this maybe dont go down to the sauna.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel we have stayed in recently”
Reviews.Author: Patrick20
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife have been fortunate enough to have stayed in about 6 four or five star hotels over the last 21 months or so in different european cities. In one we felt it was ok, not particularly good, in the others we were very happy, but this one was undoubtedly the best. I can not believe its only four star, definitely better than the 2 5 star hotels we stayed in (which which we were pleased). This stay was a four night offer from Guardian Readers Offers (or something similar), through Great Getaway, absolutely superb price, including flights with BA from Heathrow. Rooms really nice and spacious, breakfast good, staff very friendly, and although they were charging (relatively modestly) at 2 euros for an hours use of the internet, in fact until our last day the apple computers in the lobby did not ask for log in/room details so it was free! (Important to me to use internet couple of times a day at least) Was minus 15 to minus 18 degree during the day and evenings at the time (and at night hit minus 25 degree apparently) so most of our time we spent in museums, so a bit cultured out, but definitely a good trip.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent modern business hotel with great service”
Reviews.Author: Waspbiter
Reviews.Content: The hotel was excellent in almost every area. I recently used it for a conference. The accomodation rooms are well styled and have some clever touches and the meeting rooms are very well thought through including more than enough power sockets to go around and excellent audi-visual equipment. The food was also surprisingly good, esp. the lunches served during the seminar. The onlything I would have liked to have seen was more equipment in the hotel gym. The prices were very reasonable. It is not a place to stay for visting the centre of Berlin, but a brilliant hotel if organising a conference

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely beautiful hotel... fanastic visit”
Reviews.Author: shelly_here
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at Andels Hotel, Berlin as part of the Groupon offer for two nights. Our initial impression of the hotel began 4 months before our visit when we asked whether we could change the date of our visit, despite the fact that this was outside the Groupon expiry date. We were pleasantly surprised that this request was accomodated. From start to finish the staff seem to go out of their way to help their visitors enjoy their stay. The hotel is stunning, very modern with some of the best amenities that I have ever come across. It also has some unique details e.g. english TV which plays the audio in the bathroom so you never miss a moment (??!!), heated floors, as well as the more usual huge comfortable bed and powerful shower. I have read that this hotel is only rated 4* rather than 5* to encourage businessman, and I do not find this hard to believe at all. This is definitely a corporate hotel but we never felt uncomfortable or out of place for being common tourists! The conciege was helpful in advising on trips and transport links although we had some difficulty with the tram lines (although I am sure the boyfriend just got confused with the pretty maps....) The breakfast was quite simply delicious - do not miss this! - everything from waffles to scrambled eggs and salmon. We ate like pigs and didn't need feeding again until dinner time. We unfortunately did not eat our evening meals at the hotel. (the italian across the street is friendly and very reasonably priced - big portions!) We went to the Sky bar on the Friday night and the view really is excellent. The atmosphere is quite chilled and very chic - quite busy but we got good seats. Overall the hotel was the highlight of our trip. We were not particularly impressed with Berlin as a city - i think we were hoping to find more history considering its' past - but have come back raving about the Andels Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay”
Reviews.Author: casaBmajorca
Reviews.Content: just returned from a 3 night stay in a standard double at Andels. Very modern hotel, but very nicely done. Huge entrance, with warm welcome on reception. Nico took us up to our room on the 4th floor, and then helped us with all the gadgetry in the room and map of Berlin. We had a standard double with shower room, it was a good size, funky decor, flat screen etc. Good continental breakfast buffet, hot and cold. Again, very good service and lovely staff. You get the feeling, they enjoy working there.... We chose Andels even though it hasnt got the best location. We wanted to be in east Berlin, slightly grittier area, as we wanted to feel some of the history. To put it politely, the hotel is not in a great area. there is nothing around, other than graffiti. However, and this is a big however, the hotel, amenites and staff more than make up for this. The tram runs bang outside, taking you to Alexanderplatz in 10 mins. We prefered this, as we felt more like Berliners, than tourists. For us, using public transport is an important way of seeing a new city. From Alexanderplatz you easily walk to all the uber trendy boutiques, restaurants adn see great contrasts in buildings (old grey blocks, mega depressing, then beautiful buildings in really vibrant streets) Great Vietnamese restaurants.... and amazingly expensive denim shops!! overall , highly recommended. had a great mohito in the skybar as well! (keep clear of the peanuts though, they were slightly weird!!) another plus, S9 straight from Schonefield Airport, literally to the door of hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice Hotel !!! I truly recommend it!”
Reviews.Author: Tufina85
Reviews.Content: Hi, I just came back yesterday from Berlin. I stayed in this hotel with my husband from the 14th to the 18th of January. The location of the Hotel is not the best one, but it's very close to Alexander Plaz. There is a tram 24 hours x day (m5, m6) that brings you there just in 10 min and morevoer it's just accross the road the stop. There is also a train stop very close to the hotel (just 2 min) , the S9 passes there and brings you directly to the SFX airport. The public transportation service in Germany is great, I have to say. The bedroom was always nice and clean, very modern style. The bathroom was amazing too, with a huge shower :) The breakfast was continental so you can find whatever you want to eat from croissants to cheese, salami, sausages etc and it was always fresh, expect for the first day. The first night we had some drinks in the skybar as well, it's nothing special and it's kind of pricy compared to the prices of the drinks in other bar/cafe, but that is kind of expected. I would suggest you to go around the city centre to have some drinks, most of the places they have happy hours or Blue hours between 5 and 8 p.m. The service in general was good! I would go back there if I go back to Berlin :)

Reviews.Title: “good for a short trip”
Reviews.Author: Shrenik J
Reviews.Content: its a good hotel, however I felt that the room size is just a little too small for 2 people to stay. my room had some very standard entertainment system and equipment for your short stay. However I would not recommend you to stay in andel's for a trip longer than a week. But yes for however short your stay at andel is... a visit to the sky bar is a must...!!

Reviews.Title: “A very enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: 662George
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Andels Hotel for 4 Days for my husband's 60th birthday. A very large hotel that is situated in the East of Berlin. Transport links very convenient with the tram right outside the hotel. We had some very bad weather so chose to eat in a small Italian restaurant across the road one night. This was an excellent choice as the we thoroughly enjoyed our meal and at a very reasonable price too. We also ate at a local Balkan restaurant and were very pleased with both the food and the price. We were told by the concierge that there was nowhere good locally to eat but it is definitely worth a little research before you go as we came across several good local restaurants and some very reasonable pubs. Will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Short trip but good”
Reviews.Author: Kevin B
Reviews.Content: All good, arrival at 5am. but the reception staff was nice, smiling and kind. The only wrong thing was the noise from something into the floor who was knocking all night long.

Reviews.Title: “Talks a good game but does not quite cut the mustard”
Reviews.Author: Jon W
Reviews.Content: In November we booked using the Groupon offer from the hotel with an excellent value package. Having been to Berlin many times before I was well aware of the location of the hotel. The package offered room for 2 nights, breakfast both mornings, 3 course meal on one night along with a drink in the bar on the roof. Checkin was slightly disorganised, originally the receptionsist could not find the booking despite making it 6 months before but then luckily did. She then attempted to swipe my credit card for the room service and bar purchases and was unable to accept my Visa card? so I offered her another which she did manage to swipe. This however proved to have been a waste of time as every time we attempt to charge drinks to the room we were informed that reception had not swiped a card! The three course meal was a waste of time. The service was slow and the food average and there was not even a choice of what to eat, we were forced to eat the pre-assigned 3 dishes regardless whether we wanted them or not. There was again more confusion as reception had only given is one voucher between us rather than the two needed. The same also happened in the bar, which was spectacular. The room had a view of the car park and the mini-bar didn't work. The air-con was also playing up, and when I informed reception on check-out they told me I needed to close the window. Why would I open the window in November? The spa was excellent. Overall this is a beautfully furnished hotel but the service really does let it down as its just far too disorganized.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel that looks the part but lacks in soul”
Reviews.Author: duncb
Reviews.Content: Myself and my partner stayed at Andel's in mid December. As others have stated, the hotel is a little way out of "central" Berlin, but this doesn't really matter once you get to grips with the S Bahn, U-Bahn, and tram systems. You're never going to walk around Berlin, so get a pass for public transport for the amount of time you're there and you'll hardly notice the 10 min tram ride to Alexanderplatz from the hotel. The rooms are fantastic, we like modern hotels so the room ticked all the boxes. Ours was on the 6th floor and a long way from the lift. If you are unsteady on your feet may be worth asking for a room close to the lifts. The breakfast selection was extensive and the breakfast area was pleasant. We had an evening meal included in our Groupon and this was served in the "Choice" restaurant. Ironically we didn't have a choice, it was a set menu, but we were happy with the menu overall. The waiter was attentive, but we were the only two people in the entire restaurant so there was no atmosphere. We asked for some tapwater to accompany the meal and we were told that they charged for this. If this was a restaurant, I'd be annoyed at paying for tap water, but given that this was a restaurant in a hotel that we were paying guests in, we were staggered! It's the same water that comes out of the tap in our room after all! After the waiter had served our desserts he said goodbye as he was heading to the skybar to work there for the rest of the evening. We were left on our own after this point. The Skybar has superb views, and decent (if pricey) cocktails. We ate out in Berlin for the rest of our stay, mainly as there were many restaurants that were better value and had more atmosphere. The one thing that took the gloss off our stay was the glaringly obvious fact that this is a conference hotel. There are huge meeting rooms, and we regularly passed meeting delegates on their breaks around the hotel. Not that this is a problem, but we did get the impression that the hotel's main business is its conferences and so that personal touch with private guests was a bit lacking. The empty restaurant may have been a seasonal thing, but it did seem like the hotel was running on a reduced number of staff, and so service wasn't what we expected. Aesthetically, the hotel is lovely, but we don't travel to sit in and admire our hotel rooms. Given this, and the fact the hotel is slightly out of the way we'd stay again if the price was right, but we won't be rushing back.

Reviews.Title: “Wish I never left but I will be back!”
Reviews.Author: juli-scot
Reviews.Content: Check in was quick and efficient. I booked a package including breakfast and a ticket for the public transport for the duration of my stay. Got the ticket and a voucher book during check in. I recommend having a close look at this book as it gives you reduced admission to many of Berlins attractions. Back to the hotel, although it is not right in the city centre the s bahn and tram operate right outside the hotel which makes it extremely easy to get to all points of interest. Arriving at the room I found it spotlessly clean and just as advertised on the internet. There is a good choice of amenities in the bathroom (housekeeping provide a bigger range on request) and the bedroom is also well equipped with mini bar, tea/coffee making facilities, dvd player and a wide range of tv channels. Room and bathroom are quite spacious and the bed was very comfortable. First night I had some room service dinner, it was not a big choice on the menu but what I ordered was delicious and fresh throughout. Breakfast in the morning was very opulent and they catered for every taste. Breakfast staff was attentive and the restaurant had a nice atmosphere. In general I can only recommend this hotel, the staff are genuinely friendly and well informed. I have not made use of the spa facilities so can't comment on that. Should you ever get to Berlin make sure to book here - very good value for money as well!

Reviews.Title: “We'll come back to Berlin and, we'll stay here”
Reviews.Author: Rousers
Reviews.Content: A great experience from start to finish (3 nights): Courteous, knowledgeable staff (they were brilliant throughout); spacious, modern room; good spa & gym (better than some far pricier establishments marketed as 'luxury spa'); 'sky cafe' and 'sky bar' at the top offering great views across the city (if this was bang in the centre, it would be listed as a must in the guide books); extensive, good quality buffet breakfast; great transport links (plus, Berlin has a very good transport system, in the first place); lounge chair plus desk & chair; big tv with lots of channels; bathrobes & slippers; safe with power socket. Ok, it's not walkable into the centre of town; however, the transport links (plenty of tram lines plus train) mean you can get anywhere in the city quickly and easily. Don't forget, Berlin has a fantastic public transport system (far better than London or Paris). It's worth checking whether the sky cafe and sky bar (on separate floors) are booked out at all. We stayed three nights and, they were booked a fair bit; however, that might just have been the Christmas party season. We booked via lastminute.com as their mystery hotel (the one near Alexandre Platz).

Reviews.Title: “Very good, modern hotel in East Berlin...well worth a stay !”
Reviews.Author: iamtripper
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I had a 3 night night break on 9th Dec, before travelling we'd forgotten to check how to get to the hotel from the airport but after muddling through that and getting instructions for the bus and the S-Bahn we got off at the Landsberger Allee S-Bahn station. This is a long road and we wondered how far we might have to walk to find the hotel, no worries though in the end......as we came out of the station the hotel was right there across the street, very convenient ! Each day we could quickly jump on the train to get out and about in the city; we bought a 48 hour travel card for around 17 Euros each which allows you to use all public transport - S-Bahn, U-Bahn, trams and buses (we used the S and U Bahn both of which were very clean, secure and efficient). Location wise there's not a lot around the hotel in terms of restaurants but this didn't matter with the option of eating in the hotel or using a train to be anywhere in the city in a short time scale. The hotel was very modern, it was very clean and the staff were all very friendly. The room was immaculate and again very modern with a walk in shower as well as a bath. The double glazing was fantastic.....there was absolutely no noise from the outside traffic. The hotel has a nice bar called Oscar's where you can also eat....it wasn't too expensive, about 13-14 Euro's for a pasta meal although beer was expensive at 5.20 Euros. There was also a "Sky Bar" on the top floor where you can relax and look out over the city skyline and there is an A La Carte restaurant which we didn't use. Breakfast was buffet style and there was plenty there, it was the usual range of items that you would expect. There are spa facilities which looked smart (sauna, steam room etc) but unfortunately we didn't have time to use them. I'd happily book to stay here again should I return to Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sophie M
Reviews.Content: We arrived very late in the evening but were welcomed warmly by the staff. Unfortunately they gave us a twin room when we asked for a double but they didn't have any issues changing this very quickly and efficiently. The rooms are very modern (maybe a bit too modern because it took is a while to find where the wardrobe was!). The bathroom was stylish and very clean. The hotel sky bar was great and all the staff are very welcoming, the beers were good too! The choice for breakfast was amazing, the quality of the food was really good. The hotel is a stones throw away from the trainstation so it's really easy to get a train into the centre of Berlin. Overall we were extreemly happy with out stay and would definately recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Well worth a stay!”
Reviews.Author: Steph M
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Andel's Hotel from 16-18 December, and everything about the experience was an absolute pleasure. Every part of the hotel is immaculate, from the bright, welcoming reception area to the modern, stylish bedrooms. We requested a room on a lower floor, and this was granted without hesitation or hassle. The staff were always friendly and helpful, and no-one would pass you by without saying Hello (or Hallo!). There were breakfast options to suit everyone, with constant re-stocking of items which ran out quickly, and on a Sunday breakfast is available until 1pm! We dined in the ground floor restaurant Oscar's, and enjoyed a lovely meal for two with drinks for under 40 euros - not a bad deal in anyone's books! All in all, an absolute pleasure to stay at this hotel, and for the price for bed and breakfast, an absolute steal!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel break in middle of Beautiful Berlin !”
Reviews.Author: taycosmo
Reviews.Content: Andel's Hotel is in great location in Berlin , train fr Airport go straight to the station right next to the hotel and there are many buses , tram that go through the area . The hotel itself is very big and comfortable with modern look . The room was very spacious and high ceiling with separate walk in wardrobe , lovely big marbled bathroom with separate bath and shower . The room decorations was very modern and lightings excellent . Morning breakfast were breakfast buffet of many different choices which was great and will really fill you up for the whole morning . There were some restaurant , shops around the area . There is a Burger King and Aldi supermarket opposite . Free Gym access at the hotel also Sauna, Steam room and spa are free for guests at hotel but please note that No clothings are permitted in the Saunas which we found out the bad way and there may be nudists walking around in the spa - Germany ways I guess . There is an restaurant , cafe and bar at the hotel . Both Cafe and Bar are at the top of the Hotel with panoramic view of Berlin which is definitely worth the expensive but delicous drinks on offers . I went with my girlfriend and we had an amazing memorable time in Berlin and this hotel was world class an perfect place to unwind after a long day out! Highly Recommened , would stay here again in the future .

Reviews.Title: “Great designer hotel, clean, modern, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: kempie666
Reviews.Content: Booked a voucher via Groupon for the hotel - was not disappointed on arrival. If coming from Tegel Airport, then change at BreusselStrasse (bus to S-Bahn), and get the ring train round to the Landsberger Allee - 200 metres at most to the hotel from the station. trams direct to Alexanderplatz are right outside as well - easy to get anywhere in the city from here. Reception staff are very professional - happy to help, friendly and accurate in what they do. Rooms are very clean, and "designer" in style - wood floors, nice comfy sofa, massive TV, light and airy, comfortable beds, with the usual Continental duvet each on the bed. Beautiful bathroom, and wow - what a shower! Impressive is not the word! Our room was right behind the lift shaft, but there was absolutely no noise whatsoever from the machinery. Room on second floor (same floor as the Wellness area). Restaurant served delicious food - we had a set menu (due to the booking offer), but three courses, and all delicious. Hotel also accomodated a nice Hindu couple (no beef dishes), without a problem, once the staff understood about the religious significance. No fuss, no problems. Wine was expensive, but very good. Had a drink int he 14th floor Sky Bar - great views across the city - go at night, the lights across the city are beautiful, and the TV tower lit-up is such a spectacular sight (well done the old DDR!). Will stay here again when we return to Berlin to do all the sights that we missed this time.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: Vanilla13
Reviews.Content: The hotel was absolutely perfect - clean, modern, fantastic breakfast and nice staff.

Reviews.Title: “Best yet!”
Reviews.Author: Deltablade
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel in all respects.We booked via a Times offer and could not have been better pleased. Staff friendly & helpful ..room had all we needed (shower best we have ever had abroad!) if a tad mean on wardrobe space. Breakfast choice was vast (ate in Oscars first night and had pasta which was cooked to order and delicious). The concierge was most helpful, room was serviced (& towels changed) every day - even before we had returned from breakfast! Location at first glance seems a wee bit remote but as transport is so good in Berlin (tram & train station right outside hotel) it didn't matter a jot. The 'Sky Bar' on 14th floor was fabulous .Journey from Tegel airport (sadly closing) to hotel done in 30 minutes [tip - use the train, don't waste money on a taxi]. German people are so polite (including the 2 young beggars we encountered at different places who hoped that their English was ok - humbling or what!)

Reviews.Title: “Smart and Modern”
Reviews.Author: Amersham-Owl
Reviews.Content: Only stayed one night on Business but was very impressed. Very modern, clean and spacious hotel. Staff attentive and friendly, I would say service very good. Room very clean and comfortable and nice bathroom. Didn't venture from the hotel so cannot comment on location but views from the sky bar and coffee bar one floor below impressive. Breakfast selection again excellent. If within easy reach of Berlin attractions, I would consider this as a hotel to bok if travelling for pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning views from the Sky Bar”
Reviews.Author: Yvonnenetball
Reviews.Content: An ultra modern and very comfortable hotel; staffed by very helpful, friendly and pleasant people. The food was delicious and plentiful. We ate in the restaurant one night and found the service excellent, although the food and wine was a little pricey. Transport links from the airport and around the city are excellent. The cocktails we enjoyed in the Sky bar were even more enjoyable looking at the stunning city views. I thoroughly recommend the hotel to both business and leisure travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel, in a not that amazing place.”
Reviews.Author: Felipe C
Reviews.Content: The hotel is great, clean, modern and with a great service, but is not close from the best attractions in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel for a good price !”
Reviews.Author: Alexi_Vangerven
Reviews.Content: Very clean hotel, with nice and good sized rooms breakfast is excellent 10 minutes away from the centre with the metro ! metro stop 200 meters from hotel very good value for money !

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for a short stay in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: SnakeLondon
Reviews.Content: Went with my husband and friends for a long weekend. Our first trip to Berlin. Rooms are lovely, ultra modern stylish and immaculately clean. We also used the Groupon offer which was very good value for the standard of accommodation and included a meal. Found all staff helpful, concierge very knowledgable and able to supply all tickets/directions etc. The candlelit Skybar is lovely for pre-dinner drinks and the sky cafe served great cakes and coffee. The hotel is not central and the surrounding area certainly not pretty (concrete jungle and busy main roads) but connections to Alexandar Platz very easy (tram stops right outside and is really frequent). The location is far enough out that we did want to find somewhere very local to eat near the hotel and could not find a nice restaurant. There are fast food outlets however, In the shopping mall opposite the hotel we found a small mexican cafe/come restaurant. We went there on a Saturday night and all tables were taken (we did go back on Monday and ate there) so book if you want to try it. However, the ownere recommended an Italian round the back which resembled a station cafe. Food in both venues was excellent and belied the informal style of the establishments. Also very reasonable. The hotel restaurant prices, outside of the offer, are very expensive. We arranged a pick up from the airport on arrival to Shonefeld airport (45 euros) which was good and reliable and the driver was an excellent guide so this was an enjoyable introduction. However, if you are on a tight budget, the train is direct, 30 minutes and the station (Lansberger Allee, stops right outside the hotel. Tickets are 3 euros each. For the more conservative travellers - advance warning that sauna/steam rooms are of the strip down to birthday suit style. Stepping out of the changing rooms without warning was an experience if you are not used to bathing in the buff. As for Berlin itself - it's very spread out and you need to be very mobile and fond of walking to get from one place of interest to others - never quite got our heads round where the 'place to be' was - most cities seem to have them. A two or three day ticket saves money on public transport (which is all very reliable) and gives discounts on Christmas markets were beautiful and plentiful in the different areas. Everything very expensive, we came home with few gifts as a result which was disappointing. On our last day we took the hop on hop off bus tour (20 euros) which stops right outside the hotel in the morning (9.40 am) - this was a great way to get around the city and see the main sights. If we had had another day, a two day tour, not much more money, would have ensured you saw most of the main attractions and the best shopping areas. It does not come back to the hotel but connect with Alexander Platz for tram or taxi (9 euros).

Reviews.Title: “Slightly disappointed...only a little though.”
Reviews.Author: CPerkin
Reviews.Content: Bit of a mixed bag this hotel. Location wasn't great but as everyone has already pointed out, the tram to the centre of Berlin is just outside, and thanks to Berlin's excellent public transport system, it's all a breeze. The hotel itself was very nice. Reception and concierge staff were very friendly and helpful. Room was big, clean and stylish. Breakfast was excellent...lots and lots of choice and plenty of it. Now the problems. Air-conditioning switched itself off over night and we couldn't get it back on. Room did get a bit stuffy. We were woken up by cleaning team at 8.15am because they wanted to clean the room. They were polite and apologised but this is ridiculous... And the worst was the restaurant. We had an evening meal for two included in the groupon deal. Apart from the desserts which were fine, the food was very poor. The starter was a piece of meat the size of an electron hidden in jelly and the main course was a chicken dish that was very small. We both had one new potato each cut in half! To top it all off, the wine list was extraordinary. Average price was about 30euros per bottle and included supermarket wines...Wolf Blass was one of them. 34euros for a bottle of Wolf Blass is just laughable. So, we had water. But they're clever aren't they. The litre bottle of water was just under 8euros. More than £7 for a bottle of water? And that kinda put a dampener on the stay. We would stay there again but wouldn't bother with the restaurant. The breakfast, yes, the restaurant, no chance.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay!”
Reviews.Author: DarrenH4
Reviews.Content: My friend and I booked into this hotel in November 2011 and we certainly got value for money. We got a discount at the hotel as we booked through a Groupon offer. The hotel is modern and stylish and has some great facilities. We had dinner in the restaurant one night and the food was really nice, if not a little small on the portion size it was very tasty. The breakfast at the hotel was really nice and there is so much choice to help yourself to, you definitely can't miss the breakfast! We had a suite which was very impressive, the room was very clean and modern. The bathroom had a huge walk in shower, bath and large sink and mirror. The hotel isn't located right in the centre of Berlin but there is a tram station and train station right outside the hotel and the tram takes about 20-30 minutes to get more central. The trains run all night which is good for a night out as there's not the big expense of taxis as you can get a day travel ticket for about €6. The sky bar in the hotel is nice setting but there wasn't much to see from where were sat. Probably nicer sky bars n other hotels to be honest. I would recommend staying at this hotel. The staff were polite, courteous and very attentive. The large, light and welcoming reception/foyer area is impressive. There are computers to use, to get connected to the internet free of charge. There is also Wi-Fi available at a charge for €2 per hour. Had an enjoyable 3 night stay at this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Stylish Hotel, Fab Food and AMAZING cocktails!”
Reviews.Author: clare w
Reviews.Content: Stayed here back in June 2011. We were really impressed by the modern style and comfort of the hotel. It was a great deal cheaper as we had a groupon offer and this included a fab 3 course meal in their quiet restaurant.... slightly too quiet and felt like everyone could hear our conversation! But never the less a lovely meal. Wine pricey at £34euros a bottle but as the meal was included we didnt mind! The Sky Bar is amazing as you get a beautiful panoramic view which at night is even better! The cocktails are fab too! Staff very pleasant and great service. Breakfast is also extremely good and you would be hard pressed to not find anything you like. Smoked salmon plentiful! The room was very clean...beware the toilet has a clear glass door??! as does the shower! There are transport links right across the road and a great Mexican further down street which again does good food and cocktails!! Would most definately stay again.. in fact next stop Krakow Andels!!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Braveliver
Reviews.Content: Spent two nights in Nov 2011. Room was very nice, quiet, clean and well appointed. Only slight disadvantage is that there is not much around the hotel, however it was very easy (and I mean very easy) to buy tram tickets from reception and take frequent tram (M5 or M6) to Alexander Platz (10 mins). Breakfast was good too. I did find the restaurant in the hotel a little pricey for my money and their portions quite small.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jasper V
Reviews.Content: Booked the hotel as a package deal, stayed here 3 nights including breakfast for a good price. Beforehand I did read the reviews about the location, but I was trusting the Berlin public transport system that would counter the slightly remote location. Staff at the hotel was very friendly, they even changed our room to one with a bath in the evening, even though they were fully booked. Like the room, altough the aircondition made it into a bit of a sauna (it was one of the first cold days). For location: yes, it is a bit remote, but it can be easily reached via tram and metro. We had a Berlin Welcome Card with unlimited travel which came in handy. Never had to wait more than 5 minutes for a metro or tram, so very easy to travel around town.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay at Andels”
Reviews.Author: laalaa_22
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel. Lived up to it's Trip Advisor reviews. Modern design. Comfortably furnished. Superbly clean throughout. Breakfast was brilliant. I defy anyone not to enjoy it. Cocktail bar and pasta bar both great too. One slight criticism - lack of storage space in the room, small wardrobe and no drawers. Reception staff and concierge couldn't have been more helpful but breakfast waiters were a little moody.

Reviews.Title: “If only it was located nearby Alexanderplatz..”
Reviews.Author: djdora
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel on 23-25 October 2011 and we got really good price for it. Total for 3 days and 2 nights were 150€. Room : Very modern, clean and spacious. We stayed at the 8th floor with the view of the SBahn and Strassebahn and only a few steps away from the lift. We were worried that it might be noisy as people will come in and out of the lift but we couldnt hear anything. Hence, we could get good sleep at night. Toilet : Awesome. They had saperate shower and bath tub. It was really clean and design was modern. But just one thing though, they said that every room has a bath robe but we didnt get any in our room. But it didnt really bother us that much. Amenities : The room provided us with kettle, snacks and drinks. Room slippers, comb and syampoo. Breakfast : I would rate buffet breakfast as 5 star! everything was simply delicious! Staff : They were just so-so. The ones that we encountered were not as friendly as others had reviewed them. Location : The location is abit out from other places of visit. But the SBahn and Strasse Bahn is right in front of the hotel entrance. So it was not really a problem. But we wanted to travel around town at 8am on Monday and had to go through the working crowd and it was quite an ugly experience. Try to avoid rush hour when you wanna travel around with SBahn. I would rate this hotel as 4/5. Just one point missing because of the location.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious hotel near city center”
Reviews.Author: xof_be
Reviews.Content: What I like about Andel's Hotel? It is very spacious, it is extremely stylish and it is ultra-quiet. Don't get fooled by the remote location. Public transport takes you to Alexandar Platz in five minutes. The room we stayed in had a shower and a bath, a huge bed and plenty of room to stretch your legs :-). We didn't try out the main restaurant because it seemed too expensive. Besides, Berlin has too many opportunities to try out. We did give the smaller bar/restaurant (oscar's it's called) a chance but it was rather disappointing (bad price/quality ratio). The wellness facilities are good. There's a relax space, two saunas, a steam bath and a whirlpool. Be aware this hotel doesn't have a swimming pool. Staff friendliness overall was average. Reception scored pretty well. Others were less friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel- Perfect for attending a conference”
Reviews.Author: YG1978
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Andel's Hotel during a recent convention. The overall experience was excellent, with everything on spot, from the quality of the room to the helpful staff. Breakfast was amazing, with a huge variety of fresh dishes served at the very confortable dining hall. The Gym was very well equipped and spacious. Only downside is that the hotel is pretty big so expect a long walk from the elevator to the room.

Reviews.Title: “Brillant hotel, breakfast buffet staff "give us a smile"”
Reviews.Author: jka08
Reviews.Content: Myself and my wife had a long weekend at this hotel. The hotel was absolutely great, staff could not do enough for you, apart from breakfast buffet staff who were unfriendly to the point of outright rudeness. Apart from this little annoyance everything else was wunderbar.

Reviews.Title: “modern and clean hotel, just outside city-center”
Reviews.Author: Dirk R
Reviews.Content: If you want points, i'll give it a 9,9/10. The 0,10 is because it's a little bit outside the center of the city, BUT there is a tram-station just in front of the hotel and it takes 10 minutes to get to Alexanderplatz. Very modern, very clean, very friendly staff, very nice SPA and the sky-bar on the 14th floor is a must-see. Breakfast is super. The hotel-restaurant is very very good. Nouvelle cuisine. Great service. Large wine-card. Large room, mini-bar, flatscreen TV, safe. There is a large parking under the hotel. 10 eur/day

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel with friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: AnneAitken
Reviews.Content: Stayed four nights at this hotel with a group of friends. Lovely bathroom, with large walk in shower and a bath. Room very modern, with very comfortable large bed and good quality duvet and pillows. Lovely breakfast. Sky bar on 14th floor had wonderful cocktails and views across the city. Only problem was that it got too busy on the Saturday evening. Hotel is very spacious and the staff very helpful at all times. The hotel is out of the city centre, but the trams stop outside the hotel and take 15 mins to get to Alexanderplatz. Berlin is a fascinating city to visit and look forward to returning.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ckineuropa
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at this hotel. The location is good, easy to get to the centre of Berlin. The breakfast buffet was great, rooms clean and comfortable. The Sky Bar is definitely worth visiting!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: LondonDes
Reviews.Content: The hotel is modern, attractive and comfortable, but the outstanding bit for me was the service - everybody was so friendly, pleasant and helpful (and that goes for Berlin generally) - which to me makes all the difference. The staff were happy for us to check in early and to leave our luggage on our last day as our flight only left in the evening. As there were so few English channels on the tv reception hold a decent selection of DVDs, which was great. Food from room service was good, as was the downstairs restaurant. The breakfast buffet is superb and if you can get a table by the window you can sit and watch the world go by. There is also an excellent little Mexican restaurant across the road - good food, large portions and reasonable prices. Part of our package was free Berlin Welcome Cards which provided us with travel on all the trains, buses and trams which was a welcome surprise and very useful - the Welcome Card also gives you loads of discounts on entry fees and so forth. Yes, the hotel is not in the centre of town, but when you are spending all day on your feet I find that you don't much mind the chance to sit on the tram to get back to the hotel! The tram stop (and S-Bahn) is literally across the road from the hotel and run frequently and effeciently so using public transport was a breeze. Truly a fabulous experience - I would return to Berlin in a heartbeat and would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Part of a great city break”
Reviews.Author: ChrisSue5058
Reviews.Content: I have wanted to visit Berlin for several years and wasn't disappointed. We stayed here in October on a 4 night break booked through the AA. First off, it was easy from Schoenfeld airport to reach the hotel via the S-bahn to Landsberger Allee station, right outside. We got the 72 hour all-transport tickets at the airport, valid on S and U-Bahn, trams, buses with a book of discounts on various attractions. Despite arriving at 11am the receptionist was able to let us have a room straight away. Then up to the Sky Cafe for a coffee and a look-out over the city. Because we wanted to do and see a lot we spent a minimal amount of time in the hotel but were more than satisfied with it. Modern, clean, stylish bedrooms, well appointed bathroom. The buffet breakfast was really well done, catering for all tastes from fruit, cereals, hot and cold meats and fish, breads, croissants and pastries, juices, teas, coffees. A good start to each busy day. Night time eating options in the hotel were a bit limited; a very sparse a la carte menu in one restaurant and a bistro style in Oscars. We ate in the latter one night and had good but simple meals based around 'build your own' pasta dishes. Visited the Sky bar on one night, good view over the city but a bit lacking in atmosphere. Not surprisingly, almost everyone had one drink and moved on. The one downside to the hotel was its distance to the heart of the city. Located amongst some East Berlin apartment blocks, there should have been a tram outside but the line was closed for repairs for the whole five days. We disregarded the recommended option of walking to the next major intersection to pick up a tram (would have been drowned in the frequent showers) and found an alternative by going one stop on the S-Bahn and then a tram on a different line. Tram goes to Alexanderplatz, from there you have many choices of where to go and how to get there. We did the city bus tour to get our bearings before launching into museums, galleries, the Wall, Reichstag, shopping, river trip etc etc. All in all, we enjoyed the city and the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “clean, airy, modern, new fixtures, only a short tram ride to center of city”
Reviews.Author: toasty24
Reviews.Content: I have been travelling all over Germany for over a week staying in various hotels in each city. This by far is the best one for the money -- clean, airy, modern, spacious, all new fixtures, a bathroom that looks so sparkling clean and new that you can't wait to bathe. Even better than the Le Meridien hotel in Paris. The only negative to this near-5-star lodging is the location. Located on the outskirts of the city center, Alexanderplatz, you still need to take a 5-10 min tram ride, otherwise you're surrounded by.. not much. You have to get into Alexanderplatz to access the main trains and to get around the city to see all the sights. The days my boyfriend and i were there to explore Berlin , the tram was under construction (!) so we had to walk. As new yorkers, we are accustomed to walking and honestly it only took 15 minutes or so. Despite the location on the city fringe, the super clean room and amenities made up for it. In fact, we would stay there again, b/c the price is lower than what you'd pay for in the middle of the city, and you get more room for your money. If you care about staying in a nicer place, without spending too much money, and dont mind the short ride to the city, then this hotel is for you. The concierge, Michael, was undoubtedly one of the best hotel concierges we have encountered. He gave us non-touristy recommendations, and helped us book another hotel for munich plus additional inter-germany flights. Such exemplary service is so hard to find.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: gc65
Reviews.Content: Read reviews of this hotel that said it was too far out !! Cant understand what the problem is ! The tram stops right outside the hotel and your in Alexzander plaza in 7/8 mins also the train to the airport stops here. We got a ticket at the airport for 3days for €24.50 and you can jump on and off everything as much as you want , transport is excellent so to us ANDEL'S HOTEL was perfect . Spotless clean which is top of the list for me when picking a hotel. Rooms are lovely with great big beds for a good nights sleep. Bathrooms have great walk in showers . Breakfast had good with selection to pick from with something for everyone. The sky bar has great views to just sit and relax looking out at. So yes i would recommend Ande's Hotel

Reviews.Title: “Modern hotel - no atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: WarsawExplorer
Reviews.Content: I have been there only for one night. Clean, modern, quite new hotel. Do not like decorations and designs in the hotel. Good location but not the best one. Hotel too big for cosy atmosphere. One night and visit for meeting purpose is fine. Visit for a pleasure no.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay, but a little remote.”
Reviews.Author: j-winther
Reviews.Content: According to the description, the hotel was close to Alexander Plazt. But it took about 15 minuttes by tram to get there! But on the other hand the tram connection was perfect. About every 5 minutes you could get to the center of the city. The hotel is quite fancy decorated, modern and a little kitch - in the good way. It is very clean, the room was comfortable. Very modern bathroom! The staff was close to perfect: friendly, english speaking, helpfull and very competent. The restaurant was okay. We had a very pleasent stay and would probably stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “FOR THE PRICE FAULTLESS!”
Reviews.Author: rocstarocsta
Reviews.Content: stayed here for 4 nights in june 2011. loved the interior decor, rooms were clean and a reasonable size for the price. Breakfast was nice and staff excellent. Try the cocktails in the skybar! Tram stop is very handy just opposite. If your stay in Berlin this will suit just fine.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - love the decor”
Reviews.Author: wilinili
Reviews.Content: It's not in the most central location, but it's connected to the city center via the tram and train and there's a direct train from Schonenfeld airport (for those Air Berlin flyers). I loved the decor of the room and the common areas. I enjoyed some scrumptious cocktails and sweeping views in the Sky Bar on top of the hotel and had a wonderful massage and pedicure in the hotel spa.

Reviews.Title: “Most enjoyable.”
Reviews.Author: literate
Reviews.Content: Late arrival, after 11 pm due to late flight and delay with arranged taxi. We couldn't have had more attention. As all kitchens were closed our 'porter 'offered to go out to get something from nearby establishments. However Sky Bar was open and we were sustained with nuts and our drink.. Agree (with former review) that the limited choice of dinner was surprising but seeing the price of the al a carte restaurent menu not so. A concern while eating was compensated for by an extra dessert and prosceto. Excellent breakfast, but apples very hard! The consiege was acceptionally helpful,especially after we had a three and a half hour river cruise, narration all in German no translations or script. Tram outside Hotel to buses in Alexander Platz, very convenient,especially at approx £6 a day for travel on any transport. Zoo good but no guide to find your way around, hard on those less able.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: classyluxury
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed at the Andels in August as part of the Groupon deal. We had a twin room, which was nice and spacious and immaculately clean, it was a bit of a trek from the lifts but then again the hotel is huge. Beds were comfy enough, everything worked as it should. One strange thing was we found one of the TV channels showed hard core porn 24 hours a day! Bit shocking, not sure if it was a mistake and that they hadn't disabled it from the previous guests or what. Breakfast was excellent, especially the pastries and waffles. It is a little way out but the tram is so convenient it really is not a problem. Good free wifi access. The Sky Bar is busy, decent views of the city and nice and modern, good cocktails. They were happy for us to leave our luggage to collect again later before our flight. Overall, great value and comfort. Oh, and there's a 24 hour Burger King opposite if you have the midnight munchies!

Reviews.Title: “great accommodations and excellent value”
Reviews.Author: dms111
Reviews.Content: Helpful staff at this very clean, modern and friendly hotel. Excellent buffet breakfast included. Across the street from tram station to take you to downtown areas; nothing within walking distance of the hotel. Staff worked hard to provide good restaurant and travel recommendations. We had two rooms for the four of us and we would definitely recommend/stay at this property again. Very large; 500+ rooms but you never felt lost in a big place; nice rooftop lounge with excellent views of Erin.

Reviews.Title: “The best place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Sergio P
Reviews.Content: We had just 4 days, but has been enough to decide that is the best place to stay in Berlin. The hotel is really quiet, confortable. Rooms are very clean and the personnel very sweet and professional. The place is good to reach Alexanderplatz in 10 minutes, without traffic or caos in the town centre. In other words: suggested to everybody!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: FluffyEsbjerg
Reviews.Content: Can't imagine a better place to stay in Berlin, and it will certainly be our first choice next time we are going there. The staff was very friendly and helpfull. Our room and bathroom were nice and comfortable and very clean. Absolutely great breakfast buffet and the view from The Sky Bar in the evening - WAUW - don't miss it! There is a tram station just outside the front door, using that you will be in the City Centre within 10 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, only drawback might be location”
Reviews.Author: Casaben
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel as part of a travel voucher, including 2 nights accommodation, dinner for 2, welcome drinks in the Skybar, and 8 hours of bike rental for 2. All this was very well arranged by handing us a voucher with coupons that we could use at our convenience. We had to choose the date and time of dinner straight away when checking in, and we were recommended to book our bikes also fast, because they are quite popular (especially when the weather is nice). Staying a lot in hotels of this chain, I expect a certain standard, and this hotel lived up to them. Rooms Nothing bad to say about the rooms, they are spacious, with a seating area (sofa, table, relax chair) in front of the bed. The beds are comfortable. There is a TV with DVD player, and you can plug in any USB into it to disk to watch pictures, movies or listen to your music. The bathroom is big, divided into different compartments: bath, shower, toilet. The shower and toilet are separated by glass doors, and the purpose for that is not really clear. It's not that convenient. The shower is a walk in shower. There is a mini walk-in dressing and a minibar. Tea or coffee are free. Breakfast The breakfast is plentiful, with a huge choice of cereal, yoghurt, bread, danish pastry, cheese, meat, fruit, eggs, juices,... The breakfast area is big, but so is the hotel so it might be very busy during morning rush hour. The staff has difficulties in serving everybody in due time, or to clean the tables afterwards straight away. Dinner As part of the voucher, we got dinner for two. A 3 course meal was served, with no choice. I'm not sure what happens if you don't like meat, maybe you get offered an alternative. The dishes were rather small, but everything tasted nice. Would not recommend to eat here if you have been walking all day and are very hungry. Eating a la carte might be a better choice. Hotel The hotel is big, and it might take some time to walk to the room. There is a nice skybar offering a splendid view over the city (but nothing special really). There is also a spa, but we did not visit it. The lobby is huge, and different companies advertise their activities (things to do in the city). The only downside of this hotel might be its location. It's about 4km from Alexander Platz (although when walking it doesn't seem to be that far). The tram to Alex stops right in front of the hotel however. It's easy and convenient to bicycle into the city as well. To take a taxi from the centre to the hotel at night will cost about 10-15 euro (the drive takes about 10min outside of rush hour). The price matches the quality : rather high, but worth it if you're looking to stay in Berlin in style. Recommended when staying here on a business trip.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for Sightseeing.”
Reviews.Author: 3Shorties
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel as part of a voucher weekend. It was superb. It is modern and luxurious with helpful friendly staff. Not to be missed, is the sky bar from which you can enjoy stunning views over the city, and the spa which was wonderful after a full days sightseeing (I would recommend the Fat Tyre Bike Tours). The breakfast buffet was varied and delicious. We ate Dinner there one evening, and the food was delicious. Although it is not in the centre of Berlin this matters not a bit as it is right on the tram route. Getting around in Berlin is so simple and this hotel is also right on the main Train route, so were able to catch the train direct from Berlin Schoenefeld Airport. A perfect choice and I would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Funky hotel with great service, but bit far out to "pop" back in the evening”
Reviews.Author: Holiday_EKIN
Reviews.Content: This was recommended to me by a German friend who has stayed here a few times. Its a really cool hotel which manages to incorporate all the facilities and service standards of a large corporate hotel chain with the style of boutique hotel. Rooms were very funky and clean; breakfast was AMAZING buffet of anything you could wish for; food in the restaurants was Okish (the a la carte one was closed for the summer) but then Germany is not renowned for its culinary delights! The train and tram (get the M5 or M6) stops are straight outside the hotel and it takes about 10mins to get to AlexanderPlatz which is the centre of town and you can buy tickets at the hotel. Great for going in, but if it gets to 5/6ish at night, it was just that little bit too far to go back to the hotel, get changed and come back out. We tried to hire bikes from the hotel, but they had run out so they suggested the hostel round the corner, but they had also run out! In the end we went to Fat Tyre Bike Company underneath the tower in the centre of town, which in hindsight was a much better idea anyway as then we didn't have to cycle in and out of town. I haven't cycled for 20 years and I was petrified, but Berlin is so set up for cycling as you will find out as soon as you get there - there are thousands of bikes. Defintely hire one as you get to see so much more of the place without getting sore feet. Recommend seeing - Holocaust monument, Reichstag tour (you have to book 3 days in adavance via email), Checkpoint Charlie, anything at the Chameleon Theatre, museum island, and climbing up Victory Column.

Reviews.Title: “A stylish, contemporary hotel with very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: sjhHove
Reviews.Content: This spacious, stylish, contemporary hotel is located in the north east of the city just by a tram and S-bahn station and less than 15 minutes by tram to Alexandre Platz. We spent four nights here staying in an executive room which gives access to larger rooms, with well insulated windows, an excellent shower, a very comfortable bed, TV, DVD player and airconditioning. There is a separate dining and lounge area where you can have breakfast, afternoon snacks and drinks and snacks in the evening. The hotel has a pleasant spa with steam room, two saunas, a jacuzzi and relaxing areas inside and on an outside terrace. We also tried Oscars, the italian restaurant in the foyer which was very pleasant and reasonably priced. I unfortunately fell over whilst in Berlin and the staff couldn't have been more helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, pretty central, great public transport links”
Reviews.Author: nariam_frementaler
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Andel's Hotel in March, while on business in Berlin. I was pleasantly surprised with my stay here, as it was a wonderful hotel, ideal for any business travellers. The hotel is spotlessly clean, modern, spacious and bright. The rooms was spacious and the bathroom was very modern and clean - the shower was great! The hotel is ideal for business travellers (or anyone visiting a show at the Messe). The trams stop outside the door of the hotel. Would highly recommend this hotel for future travellers!

Reviews.Title: “Really pleasant stay!”
Reviews.Author: 841Elisa
Reviews.Content: Hotel is modern, clean and comfortable. Good breakfast buffet and service overall. Dennis at reception was very helpful and friendly...the most chilled out guy in Berlin!

Reviews.Title: “Overall a good base for a Berlin adventure!”
Reviews.Author: Missd123
Reviews.Content: Location-really good as long as you don't mind getting on public transport and exploring the city. breakfast-plentiful! rooms-standard with a good shower and a comfy bed. Hotel-great sky bar! Service-either amazing or terrible it depends on who is working. Berlin itself-a gritty and sometimes grubby, historical small city. Amazing people and culture, wonderful place!

Reviews.Title: “a great hotel, we would happily return there”
Reviews.Author: annh23
Reviews.Content: The room was large and comfortable.We were surprised (pleasantly) that it was equipped with a USB /dvd player so that we could watch a couple of things that we had brought with us on the 42inch screen rather than the laptop. Everything we asked for was provided immediately (bathrobes/slippers/extra soap). The desk and concierge couldn't have been more helpful. The breakfasts were excellent, with lots of good quality variations of food, so that over a 7 day stay you could have interesting and different breakfasts each day. The fitness centre was well equipped and maintained, as were the sauna and spa. `the hotel exceded our expectations and we were very comfortable indeed.

Reviews.Title: “My 40th birthday, Berlin”
Reviews.Author: MarcusPos
Reviews.Content: A wonderful hotel, one which we would both stay in again and recommend to all. Only about 5 tram stops from Alexanderplatz, there is no problem at all with the hotel being a little out of the centre. It really is only about 10 mins into the hub of everything. The room was reasonably sized, well-equipped with a decent, large, walk-in shower. The room keycards were particularly good (not that we have seen anywhere previously) whereby lift access to the floors was only possible with a room key. Ideal to keep out unwanted guests! And the breakfast, as mentioned by numerous others who have stayed here, really is the best we have experienced. Being a lover of strong coffee though, I did find the coffee served at breakfast rather weak! Only a small grumble, but a grumble nonetheless. Overall though, a very, very, good hotel. 9/10. Marcus & Emma Postlethwaite, Devon, England

Reviews.Title: “super hotel”
Reviews.Author: annie1999
Reviews.Content: this hotel is great. good service, clean, nice sauna. easy to travel from the hotel to the centre. just perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, not so nice neighborhood...”
Reviews.Author: seetheworld9999
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a hotel in Berlin where you can just walk out and enjoy the sights and sounds, Andel's is not for you. However, if you don't mind the convenient tram ride (I mean convenient as in 10 steps from hotel's front door and 5 mins from Alexanderplatz), Andel's is great for its value. The Hotel lobby is spacious, bright and welcoming. The staff is generally friendly and the concierge is very helpful in getting tram and tour tickets. I was traveling with my husband and my brother's family of 5, 3 rooms in total. The rooms are clean, contemporary, airy, bright and spacious with extra tall ceiling. The bed was really comfortable and the bathroom is spacious and clean with adequate amenities. Breakfast buffet was included in the room rate and the buffet spread was pretty good. It got crowded though as it was the summer holiday season. The hotel has many dining options, from casual pizzas, pasta to more fancy dining. We had reservation for a 3-course meal at the Choice but unfortunately the restaurant was closed unexpectedly the evening of our reservation. The hotel did not notify us of the closure, we found out from this posting at the restaurant door of the change. It was very poorly indicated as to where to go if you have a reservation, we found out from the receptionist that we need o go to the restaurant where breakfast was served. We had prepaid for the 3 course meal which was at 34eur per person, instead we were served a 3-course buffet (choice of salmon or chicken) which only cost 21eur per person. We felt totally gypped but didn't feel like management would make the adjustment so we didn't even bother mentioning it. This was the only negative experience we had with the hotel; otherwise it's a good hotel for its value. The sky Bar on the top floor (14th floor, I think) was nice but very small so seating is very limited if you go there past 9pm. To be honest, as Berlin is rather flat we found the view nothing special. Two hours after we checked out, my nephew realized he left his ring in the room so we called the hotel and they were able to locate the ring and it was a happy ending. Andel's was a good choice for this family trip but it's not a hotel I would return again given there are so many other hotels in Berlin city center. Stayed 2 nights in mid-July 2011

Reviews.Title: “nice modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: maudtie
Reviews.Content: very nice, modern hotel, clean spacious rooms. great breakfast. tram and S-bahn in front of the hotel. some shops across the street. beautiful bathroom, nice beds. with the S-bahn it is a short distance to the nice area of Prenzlauer Berg. by tram you can go to Alexanderplatz. the only thing that is not so nice is the surrounding of the hotel, it is not a nice area to stroll around. but for the rest we had a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel - Terrible Location”
Reviews.Author: Crystal1210
Reviews.Content: Great things about this hotel: 1.) The BREAKFAST buffett was AMAZING! Such a large spread of meats, cheeses, eggs, toast, pastries, juices, coffees, teas, etc. I didn't try any of the restaurants at the Hotel but the breakfast was certianly to die for. 2.) Large, spacious, CLEAN rooms. The rooms are decorated brilliantly and everything was super clean. Plus, flat screen TVs. Which leads me to my number 3.... 3.) ENGLISH language TV programs! I know people will judge me for this but after a loooong day of sight-seeing and tourist-ing I love to come back to the hotel and sip some tea and watch some TV. Not speaking any German, I was thrilled to find TV shows and movie channels in English. 4.) The AC worked amazingly and the rooms were surprisingly quiet. All and all I have to say this hotel is rather decadent for the price you pay. Overall, I found what little interaction I had with the staff pleasant and efficient. I really don't have anything BAD to say, except that the location was not what I was expecting. I am someone who loves walking around and exploring neighborhoods and seeing what there is to see... However, there is absolutely NOTHING around this hotel that I could find that was worth looking at or even any places to shop within walking distance (not counting the BK across the street). I was able to walk to Aleksanderplatz (sp?) after about a 40 minute trek. Along the way there was simply old, deteriorating buildings and lots of traffic. But again, there is a train stop RIGHT in front of the hotel... So if you don't like to walk, you're golden!

Reviews.Title: “The Best Stay Ever - Use This Hotel”
Reviews.Author: martpt
Reviews.Content: An absolutely fantastic place. Very big yet they have managed to make it feel welcoming and comfortable. Boutique style rooms, the most helpful staff I feel I've ever had in a hotel and a wonderful buffet breakfast - served until 13.00 on Sundays! Now that's consideration for the guests. The service and rooms cannot be faulted from reception staff, Sebastian - the conceige, the sauna staff and the maid service. Ten out of ten for all of them. There is a wonderful sauna area - the shy English may find the fact that everyone is nude slightly daunting. Get over it - we all have bodies.
