Great view from the windows in the sauna - better than looking at wooden walls. The hotel has a great little fitness centre with a terrace you can exercise on - I did my yoga there and loved it. Location wise some have criticised it. No reason to. If you are staying in West Berlin and wanted to see some of the major sites in East Berlin, such as Checkpoint Charlie, the Jewish Museum, it's actually nearer. Transport links are great and it's like being in the Circle Line on the Tube in London and having to travel into Oxford Circus. Love my barefoot running and the hotel staff recommended a local park - Friedrichschain - which has a fitness trail and it's where many locals exercise, have picnics and relax. You won't find the hustle and bustle of the centre and that is what makes this hotel so appealing. It's rated as 4 star yet really is 5 star - it's kept lower to enable some professional groups who aren't allowed to stay in 5 star hotels to use it. Go and see what I mean!

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: SimonWWA
Reviews.Content: We visited Hotel Andels as the next stop during the honeymoon. We spent here only one night, but we can confidently recommend this hotel. Service very professional, well-furnished rooms, very clean. Excellent breakfast, very large selection. The absolute highlight is the sky bar where you can have some very good drinks and you can still eat very well. The view is priceless. We'll be back soon, as we want to visit Berlin for a few days now. Higly recommended to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful rooms for beautiful people.”
Reviews.Author: judrop500
Reviews.Content: Went to Andel's on a Groupon deal. Food in the restaurant was a-maz-ing - but don't expect a menu - it's that German posh restaurant thing of getting-what-you're-given. Breakfast choice was brilliant - loved the waffles at Friday breakfast, and three choices of honey, and the mini-donuts, and about 50 types of bread. The Deluxe room was spectacular. Service was pretty good but a couple of the concierges were a bit miserable, and the room cleaning left a LOT to be desired. The Sky Bar had amazing views and the free flavoured beer was lovely. Very good access to town on the tram straight to Alexanderplatz (15mins), and on the S-Bahn to Schönefeld Airport (30mins).

Reviews.Title: “Some good some bad”
Reviews.Author: usa30
Reviews.Content: As some other reviewers have said, the rooms are nice but the restaurants are soulless and disappointing, apart from the buffet breakfast. The service was very unpredictable - some very helpful and some not - perhaps because the hotel is new and a lot of the staff appear to be inexperienced. The SBahn and Tram just outside the door are great if you are happy to use the very efficient Berlin transport system. The Berlin Welcome Card, available at the Berlin airport tourist counters, is a good deal, offering 3 days unlimited use of all public transport, including Potsdam and the airports (get the card for zones A, B, and C, not the slightly cheaper one for A and B only) for only Euro 25. It also includes lots of other tourist discount vouchers. Trams to/from Alexanderplatz are the M5 and M6 to Landestrasse S Bahn . Strassenbahn direct to/from Schoenefeld Airport is the S9, which takes 30 minutes. Travelers from Tegel Airport can get the TXL Express bus to Alexanderplatz and change to the M5 or M6 tram there. We enjoyed being in a very non-touristy neighborhood and discovered some really good southeast Berlin attractions not well known to foreigners, such as the Muegelsee, a huge lake with lots of excursion boats and very attractive beer gardens and coffee houses nearby. There is also a very old island community called Koepenick with charming 17th century architecture that seems a million miles away from the hustle and bustle of central Berlin, as well as such attractions as the Stasi Museum, for Cold War buffs, and the German-Russian Museum, which marks the spot of the German surrender in World War II.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel - we would recommend this”
Reviews.Author: Smiff58
Reviews.Content: I disagree with some of the reviewers regarding location. This hotel has a tram stop right outside and is only 10 minutes away from Alexanderplatz. There are a few bars in the area so you don't have to stay in the hotel. The room was clean and well equipped. Food was a little disappointing with no choice for dinner (but there are plenty of good places to eat around Alexanderplatz). Staff were helpful and always available to answer questions. The Sky bar and cafe have lovely views over the city, although they are a bit soul-less. I would definitely recommend this hotel for couples visiting Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Great for conferences”
Reviews.Author: hoorayfarray
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a conference. The conference facilities and customer service were great. The guest rooms were clean and comfortable. Only downside is location is a bit further away from the center or town so made seeing the city a bit challenging --- but there is a tram stop nearby. The staff was attentive and helpful. And their were many amenities onsite. The spa was great as well.

Reviews.Title: “Some staff not helpful at all”
Reviews.Author: Lillytang2010
Reviews.Content: I wanted to delay the check out for half an hour because I had to pack, so I called the reception, but the answer is simply 'I'm afraid not'. I mentioned that I only needed a little bit extra time to pack my stuff, answer was still simply 'I'm afraid not' I forgot my sun glasses in the room, and I called right after I left the hotel. After a whole afternoon, and three calls I made, I still can't get an answer of whether they found it or not. They said they'll call back, but that never happens. They first said that later tonight I can get an answer, and then tomorrow noon time. I explained that I have to fly out really early morning tomorrow, but they simply said they can't help. This is really not the German efficiency that I expected.

Reviews.Title: “Good Berlin Hotel”
Reviews.Author: yachtracer
Reviews.Content: Here for a conference so never actually left the hotel. Great first impressions with impressive lobby and welcoming staff. First room was a very nice twin however the front desk changed to a double no problem (Best to ask first). The cafe on the ground floor does a very nice selection of simple pastas and good wine selection and the main restaurant offers a more formal experience with well presented food and attentive staff. Sky Bar is excellent with nice salty snacks to make you thirsty. Good selection at Breakfast buffet. Only down side is having to pay for the rather slow WIFI ! Would definitely consider when returning as a tourist based on the good value rates and modern clean feel of the hotel. Yes, it's not actually near too many of the main attractions they are only a short taxi ride away.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but not near the city centre”
Reviews.Author: squizzi1969
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel as a mystery hotel on trip advisor as it was advertised as being close to Alexanderplatz. This hotel is a 10-15min tram ride from Alexanderplatz. To me, to be near something means within walking distance which it wasn't. Given this, the hotel has a tram stop out the front and an S-bahn station about 100metres down the road. The hotel was very clean and modern and the breakfast buffet was great. I cannot fault the service I received from the hotel, I am just very disappointed that location was not as described.

Reviews.Title: “Good ‘All-Round’, stylish hotel”
Reviews.Author: JacQCheshire
Reviews.Content: We agree with all the positive comments made previously about this hotel. Although not as central in location as its website makes out, the tram connections are plentiful, direct and fast – getting us into the hub from Reception always in less than 10 minutes. Also worth noting is its convenience for Schönefeld airport – 30 minutes S-Bahn route that arrives directly beside the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing and Awesome Andel's!”
Reviews.Author: laurathegenie
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at Andel’s for 4 nights and our rooms were on the 5th floor. The rooms were modern and funky with a large flat screen TV and DVD player. There was a well stocked mini bar, in-room safe, tea and coffee making facilities and bathrobes and slippers. The room was clean and spacious and the bathroom had a fabulous walk in shower and separate bath. The whole hotel is really clean, light and modern. I am partially sighted so all the colour contrasts and lighting were really well done. The staff were polite and helpful, especially Mr Fix it who always had a weather report or transport advice to hand! Breakfast was amazing because of all the choice – ranging from everything you would expect for a full English, to waffles, to pastries, to cheese and a large selection of fresh fruit and pastries. On a Sunday, breakfast is served until 1pm which I think is brilliant and more hotels should follow suit! The breakfast room was huge and it was always possible to get a table for our family even with a conference going on. Plus the staff were attentive and professional so the buffet was kept well stocked and you didn’t have to wait long for coffee or for plates to be cleared away. The hotel is a little way out of central Berlin but half the fun was getting on the tram to Alexanderplatz or further into Berlin. There are regular trams every 7 or 8 minutes and t he tram stop is just outside of the hotel. We flew into Tegel so chose to get a taxi and this was about 30 euros each way. There always seemed to be taxis outside. Check in was easy – plenty of staff so no queues and they were always on hand to lend out adapters and help with postcards. The Sky bar is fantastic – especially all the staff who were so friendly and helpful. My family loved the view and enjoyed watching a massive thunderstorm on one night. There were a large range of drinks including non-alcoholic cocktails. The food was first class – especially the Currywurst! I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone travelling to Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Misleading but Friendly Helpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: anchor_grill
Reviews.Content: Travelling to the hotel was more like a trip through Soviet Russia.Its on the East side of Berlin so dont expect to see much more than Graffiti and dogs with muzzles. I was travelling with my mother who had a sore back so when we booked this Hotel we were reassured it was very close to the centre. Not being very familiar with big city layouts I didnt know this ment it was a 30min journey by tram/train/bus to find a pleasent area that I would consider clean enough to have a coffee in. The hotel itself is amazing, they made a real effort to suit our dietery requirement after a day of trailing through Berlin without food! The rooms were spotless and the conceriage was a great help, despite not telling us what side of the tram station to stand on, so we ended up miles out of Berlin(it was even off the tourist map)! All the staff were lovely and were so patient as my Mum and I are both still learning Germany (they all spoke fluent English anyway!) Overall Fantastic hotel, but perhaps more suited to buisness or seasoned travellers than newbies to city breaks.

Reviews.Title: “Not central but an excellant hotel”
Reviews.Author: JaiJai30
Reviews.Content: This hotel is relatively far out of central Berlin (wherever that is!!) but our suite was unbelievable. Service was very pleasnt if abit lacking in co-ordination. (4 requests to get room cleaned). A great hotel that I would definitely stay at again!

Reviews.Title: “Top service,top hotel & fab stay!”
Reviews.Author: Pixie_Thunder
Reviews.Content: Had a very good stay just before the easter break. Although the hotel is not central Berlin, it is not so far as to cause too much inconvenience. Plus as part of our booking we got 2 48 hr passes for the city transport- free subway, train, tram and bus travel around the city! And the travelcard got us discounts for some museums and food places (hard rock cafe we got a massive free icecream!) The breakfast in thr hotel was well worth it too. The timings were great as it was up until 10.00am, so not too early for the leisure travellers. It had lots of choice- continental, hot, yoghurts, cereal, lots of meats, pastries etc. Great for a day of sight seeing, often kept us going till our evening meal. The staff were very helpful also. We had an incident of some clothes go missing from our room. Assuming they got taken by accident when housekeeping cleaned our room, we phoned reception, who straight away got someone to check the laundry- clothes were found, they brought them up, very apologetic & After 10mins another knock on door, with a free bottle of wine and a note expressing how sorry they were for the mix-up. We were just glad our clothes were found, and the extra lengths they went to was very impressive. The hotel, is smart, clean and very modern. Its location was approx 30 mins by train and bus from airport (only 2.60 euros) and approx 15mins from main attractions in the city. We had an excellent couple of days in Berlin and the Anders hotel was a big part in that. Would definately stay there again and reccomend to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Modern hotel with very good service”
Reviews.Author: caroline456
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for three days with work and had a very comfortable stay. The room was spacious and as I was on the seventh floor, had a view over to central Berlin. The quality of the food was very high and breakfast is certainly worth paying for. The sky bar is really funky and the food served in the sky bar isn't bad value for a hotel bar. I found the staff were very helpful and friendly. When walking around the hotel, the housekeeping staff all stoped and greeted me and the staff at the front desk were able to provide good advice on transport. The conference facilities are excellent, although the wifi is not free at this hotel (€3/hour). The only downside to staying in this hotel is that it is in a fairly derelict area with few decent shops or facilities, although the hotel has several restaurants and a small shop. public transport in Berlin is excellent so it is easy to get into the centre, but if I was staying for pleasure I would prefer to stay in a more lively area.

Reviews.Title: “Otherwise good hotel let down by poor bedroom design”
Reviews.Author: NautiusMaximus
Reviews.Content: On the whole, this was a very good hotel. The staff were extremely helpful, and they always seemed to have enough people at reception to avoid queues, even at busy times. The food was lovely. I was there for a conference, and all the conference arrangements worked flawlessly. But the one bad point was the room design. The bedrooms had been "designed", clearly with the intention that they should look impressive and trendy. That's all very well, but I would much prefer a bedroom that had been designed with the intention that someone might actually want to stay in it. The room was completely impractical. There were no drawers at all to put your clothes or anything else in, and only a fairly minimal amount of hanging space. Now, if perhaps you're only staying overnight or you just prefer to live out of your suitcase, that may not be a problem, in which case I would certainly recommend the hotel. However, I was there for a few days, and I prefer to unpack my kit when I arrive, which was simply not possible. So be aware of that if you're thinking of choosing this place. A couple of other minor niggles: the TV in the bedroom came on to a channel showing adverts for the hotel chain by default. Nothing wrong with that, of course, most hotels do that these days. What was different here, however, was that you then couldn't change channel until after it had played a complete loop of the advert. That was annoying, and I only watched TV a couple of times in my stay. If you like to watch TV several times during your stay, I imagine you'd end up throwing things at the TV before very long. Also the wireless internet access was a bit unreliable. Perhaps my bedroom was located particularly far from the nearest access point, but I found my connection dropped far more often than I would have liked. On the plus side, the internet was free, although I'm not sure whether it's always like that or whether that was a special deal for the conference I was staying at. Check if that's important to you.

Reviews.Title: “situation Perfect”
Reviews.Author: myraom
Reviews.Content: Andels hotel was a superb choice, its proximity to public transport was the best thing about it. Out the front door and there was the tram!!! The breakfast was also great set us up for the day. the front desk staff were all very helpful. The only negative point was the cost of the roof top bar, we had something to eat there on our arrival which was very good but expensive but the view was great. I would stay here again and recommend it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “excellent i would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: martinfromnl
Reviews.Content: I stayed the last week of april in Andels. Nothing bad, breakfast ok, rooms ok, they deliverd even a free newspaper every morning. free coffee and tea facilities on the room. Near a s-bahn station, 15 minutes by tram to Alexanderplatz. Perfect hotel. I asked them on forehand for a room with view on the innercourt and it was possible. I arrived on 2nd easterday and there were some small chocolate cakes as a present.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for weekend break with style”
Reviews.Author: doc50
Reviews.Content: I would echo a lote of the reviews here, this is an excellent hotel, slightly (and quietly!) out from the centre of Berlin, but a tram stop in the middle of the street outside the front door gets you to Alexanderplatz in 10 minutes or to Museuminsel in 15 with no changes. (Just make sure the tram is going to the terminus though, some finish "short" only 1 stop away!) The S-Bahn stop for the "Ring" services is the other side of the road. Reception just doesn't seem to be rushed ever, they are friendly and helpful at all times. They let us keep our room for an extra 90 minutes at check out without a fuss. We were upgraded to the 6th floor, an executive room, it was large, spacious, clean welcoming and secure. The bathroom even had underfloor heating for cold Berlin nights! Breakfast was very large, satisfying, well cooked and presented, with good waiter attention for greeting and coffee. The sky bar is worth a visit for cocktails and the view, we managed to get an immediate seat and service at 11pm. Our only complaint was that a double bed really needs a double duvet, not two singles but it was very comfortable, a very minor problem. We would return in a flash, recommended+++

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: Beverage29
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 4 night stay at Andel's hotel. Our first impression upon arriving at the hotel was how impressive and modern the lobby was. We had caught an early flight and were pleased when the friendly and helpful receptionist said that we could check in straightaway. We had a corner room on the 4th floor,which was huge with a good sized bathroom. The room was very modern and looked very boutique like. We loved it,especially the flat screen tv and king size bed! We also liked the tea/coffee making facilities. The breakfasts in the morning were very good. There was a selection to suit everyone's needs and this would keep is going for hours afterwards! The Sky cafe and bar were lovely too,with amazing views of the surrounding areas. There was a great selection of cocktails in the Sky bar and even a DJ in the evenings on some nights! We wanted to try the fine dining restaurant on our last night,but unfortunately as we didn't book ahead,we were not able to get a table. This was the only thing that we felt really disappointed about,as the menu sounded so delicious and we had been looking forward to it all day. We will definitely be staying at Andel's again when we next visit. The location is superb-it is right across the road from the trams and trains. The staff were all so friendly and helpful and we loved our room. Thank you to everyone at Andel's! Next time,we will remember to reserve that table at the fine dining restaurant!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel all around”
Reviews.Author: SIMONBEwhurst
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed two nights of faultless accomodation and service whilst staying in Berlin for a city leisure break. The hotel although not centrally located is only a short tram ride to Alexanderplatz from which the rest of the city is easily reachable by other public transport, which is cheap and frequent. Meals were excellent both in the top class "a.choice" restaurant breakfast room and sky bar, from which there is a great view of the city skyline. Rooms were modern and spotless, all stafff were polite, efficient and helpful, especially with travel plans. I would definitely use again if staying in Berlin

Reviews.Title: “This design hotel has all the comforts...”
Reviews.Author: 19Caesar80
Reviews.Content: Looks: This hotel is very stylish with it's designer lounge seats, slim designs of the rooms and basic use of colors. It exhumes a bit of a 70's atmosphere, which I personally like very much. Food: The breakfast is quite extensive and of good quality. Comparable (or more than comparable) to the mainstream 4* (business) hotels. The dinner in the 'a choice' restaurant was very nice as well, although a little posh and quite pricey. But I guess that's normal for a restaurant in this type of hotel. Customer friendliness: Very good. Hotel personnel is very correct and polite. They assist you when needed and take there time. Facilities: I didn't check a lot of these so I can only comment on the bikes we rented. This was a bit of a letdown because i didn't think the bikes were that well maintained. Maybe, being a mechanical engineer, I have high standards but since I had to fix 2 of the 4 rented bikes myself I think they should maintain their bikes better. Rooms: Very spacious and clean. Especially the bathroom is a positive surprise: large walk-in glass shower, large bath tub and toilet, all separated by glass. Very good looking! The beds were comfortable but the bed sheets were NOT: they are too small for a 1.85m person. If you want to tug in nicely, your feet won't be covered by the bed sheets. Beside the lacking in length, 2 person bed sheets didn't seem to be available... Overall I'd say it's a very very nice hotel, although it still shows some (tiny) rough edges...

Reviews.Title: “Good location, nice decor but...”
Reviews.Author: ktboo09
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for 5 days whilst visiting family in Berlin. First off all, perhaps this is not the kind of place to stay for more than a few days, it seems more geared towards business types though we did like the hotel overall. There were lots of things that were excellent about the hotel so I'll mention those first. 1) The hotel is really close to the S-bahn and trams making it easy to explore the city. 2) The decor is modern and clean in the rooms and lobby. 3) Bathroom/Shower was fantastic. 4) Reception staff/Concierge/Doormen were extremely friendly and helpful. 5) Breakfast was amazing; a tremendous selection of food which provided a great start to each day. The main things that bothered us about the hotel were 1) The rooms (although clean and nicely decorated) were small and there was hardly any wardrobe/drawer space - certainly not enough for 2 people for 5 days! 2) Bar staff in The Sky Bar were slow and not especially friendly - we didn't feel very welcome on the few occasions we went up there (the view however is great!) 3) The hotel does have a spa though we didn't use it, when we went to have a look around the lady was quite rude and seemed like she couldn't be bothered us showing us the facilities. 4) No wi-fi...unless you pay 30 euros to go into some 'lounge'. Overall I would use the hotel again as it was a great location but it was not as amazing as I'd anticipated based on other reviews on here.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect hotel!”
Reviews.Content: I spent 4 nights for a workshop in this hotel. I loved Andel's for everything. Rooms are beautifully fitted out and superbly decorated. Breakfast and lunch are superlative and also the restaurant for the dinner is magic: service and menu are impeccable. The only negative thing: if it had had free internet, it would have been better. I was forgetting...prices are low reporting to the quality level it offers.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent! - except for the location”
Reviews.Author: ar0und_the_w0rld_17
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, beautiful, extremely good service, big rooms, wonderful breakfast! Really can recommend! Only minus is that that they advertise that they are centrally located, just a short distance from Alexanderplatz, which is not true! Oh well, maybe with a jet plane.

Reviews.Title: “Place 2 Come Back 2 When in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: Toliko
Reviews.Content: I loved the whole experience of staying in this hotel. The receptionists were helpful and courteous, the bartenders at the ground floor - very friendly and polite. Definitely the hotel i am going to choose again when in Berlin. Highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dizzytraveller00
Reviews.Content: We loved Andel's. Beautifully fitted out rooms with comfortable beds and funky modern decor, great breakfasts, a bar with a view across the city, and convenient public transport into town. If it had had free internet, it would have been a perfect hotel.

Reviews.Title: “superbly satisfied.”
Reviews.Author: neilfromcanada
Reviews.Content: this hotel was top notch in every respect. the service, the cleanliness, the staff, and the BREAKFASTS (the best in all of berlin, no doubt), were excellent. would absolutely recommend this hotel to any traveler, with kids or without. the executive lounge is a treat; splurge on it if you can: the food is delicious and a very nice atmosphere. the rooms were large and well equipped: the linens were clean and crisp, and very comfortable overall. a special appreciation to michael, the concierge, for his unwavering assistance and formidable attention to our family, making our stay truly unforgettable. stay at the andels hotel, you will not regret it. while the distance might appear far from the city center, the hotel is located right beside trams, and getting downtown is easy and affordable.

Reviews.Title: “How come this not rated No.1???”
Reviews.Author: COB21
Reviews.Content: I only ever post on TA if something is exceptionally good or bad. I am pleased to report that Andel's was excellent in every respect. On our last day my wife and I, both seasoned travelers, were trying to think of any aspect that we could be critical of - we really couldn't think of anything. Room very modern and clean. Service efficient and friendly. Buffet breakfast extensive and of the highest quality Location - I guess this was the only thing you could perhaps criticise as it is not slap bang in the centre of Berlin (although I guess Berlin is more a sprawly city so perhaps does not have a true centre?) but with a tram and railway station right outside your door you had instant access in 10/15 mins to the whole of Berlin. Forget the rest book Andels.

Reviews.Title: “MOTOWN PARTY 2011/ARTIST, AND GUEST OF ANDEL'S BERLIN!”
Reviews.Author: rayneonme7
Reviews.Content: totally professional! close to all amenities, customer service like none other! would highly recommend this to anyone wanting a true experience of quality, and customer service. l.a. emmanuel

Reviews.Title: “The ideal hotel, het ideale hotel, das ideale Hotel in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: MediaEvents
Reviews.Content: After having been there for work in 2009 we, my girlfriend and I, wanted to stay at Andels' for a pleasant stay at the capital of Germany. It's a 4 **** + hotel and the service is great. It is situated at the former DDR (east)side of the city and that is good to observe in the surroundings. Long alleys and "strong" buildings and some areas where there have to be build soon. The S-Bahn (not underground!) is almost connected with the building and brings you everywhere you need to go, it's the S-Bahn ring around the city! At the Landesberger Allee it self the streetcar (Tramway) is also a good one for quick travel to Alexanderplatz for example, and from here to the rest of the city by U-bahn (yes, that's the underground!). Places like Volkspark Friedrichshain are near and walkable. by tram Prenzlauerberg (Notting Hill!?!?) is good to do, one step-over and it brings you to the top of Kastanienallee, and from here it's only downwards to streets like Kollwitzplatz (Italian restaurant Istoria, yammie!). Downhill a tram or U-bahn brings you back to Alexanderplatz and the hotel. If I get started, and can't stop, but I will.... otherwise you won't read it all :-) One thing, it's surely told by everyone here I guess... The club at the upper floor of the tower of the buiiding, can't be missed, great view especially over nighttime Berlin and good cocktails.

Reviews.Title: “Service is impeccable”
Reviews.Author: nickynoo74
Reviews.Content: One of the nicest, most modern hotels I've stayed at. Great food and so clean. Location a little out of town but means you get to experience the excellent public transport services of Berlin and the old East side of the city. Brilliant service - all staff incredibly friendly. They couldn't do enough for us. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hotel. Highly Recommended.”
Reviews.Author: ST1951
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this excellent hotel for four nights in January. It was booked as a package with British Airways. The transfer from Tegel was amazingly simple and I was in the hotel 30 minutes after leaving the airport at a cost of €2.30! I was slightly dismayed that I had to wait for 1.5hrs until 4.00pm to get into my room but the wait was worth it. I had emailed in advance for a quiet room to be allocated and I was not disappointed. The room was on the top floor overlooking the courtyard. I didn't hear a sound on any of the four nights I was there! The room was spotless and the bed comfortable. Good sized flat screen TV, DVD player and well stocked mini bar.The only slight complaint I have is that storage space for clothing was limited. There were no drawers so I had to keep some clothing in my case. It would ceratinly have been a problem if two peopel had been staying in the room. Good job my wife was not with me in view of the amount of clothes she packs!!!! Breakfast was superb. An amazing selection. Probably one of the best breakfasts I have had in any hotel and I have stayed in quite a few over the years. I was a bit disappointed with the location of the hotel when I arrived but my concerns were groundless as it was not a problem at all. There is a tram stop right outside the hotel and it is only 10mins to Alexanderplatz. Tickets can be purchased from the very helpful concierge. There didn't seem to be any decent bars or restaurants around the hotel but there are plenty enough in the more central Berlin area. Internet access at the hotel was slightly confusing. When I arrived I was told that full access was €15.00 per day which I thought was very steep and much more than I have paid in any hotel. Given that many hotels and fast food outlets offer complimentary Wi Fi I am, indeed, surprised that any hotel should charge at all. I was then told that there was a "limited" service which I could use for one hour each day free. When I logged on for the first time I was, indeed, offered two choices. The next time I logged on I was, however, presented with a totally different screen which gave me a user name and password for unlimited free access. I checked with reception and was then told that Wi Fi was, in fact, free. Certainly a case of mixed messages. Would I use this hotel again? Most certainly! I thoroughly enjoyed my stay there and thank all the staff for making it such a great place to stay. Please do not hesitate to stay there yourself. You will not regret it.

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel & service”
Reviews.Author: c2-barber
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a fantastic place to stay. Friendly and attentive staff. Lovely spa area. I'd recommend the executive upgrade for large, clean and relaxing rooms, free premier wifi connection with access to the private executive lounge and smokers lounge. It was no problem that this hotel was slightly out of the main tourist area. It's only a 30min direct train ride from Schonefeld Airport. Both tram and train stations are directly outside of the hotel. Included in our deal was a 72hr welcome card which enabled free access to transport and discount on tourist attractions. Transport in Berlin is very easy to navigate. The Sky bar has gorgeous cocktails. Highly recommend this hotel for a leisurely stay in this fantastic city.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic quality and service”
Reviews.Author: badge669
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights and have to say that the experience was fantastic, excellent well trained and courteous staff, nothing was too much trouble. The rooms were spotless and bed linen changed every day. The concierge was extremely helpful and knowledge. On arrival we were greeted politely, our bags were delivered to the room and the concierge gave a 10 minute overview of the hotel. The hotel is well placed, just a short tram ride to Alexanderplatz, the tram stop is right outside the door. Would certainly recommend this hotel without hesitation. Looking forward to staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fantastic!!”
Reviews.Author: kifinasflyer
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel! I stayed at the hotel for 3 nights. The rooms were a big surprise. Much better than the pics they have on the internet! Very big very clean and very modern>Specially the bathroom. The hotel is next to a train and a tram station. You should definitely visit the skybar at the top floor with a fantastic view over Berlin! One of the best hotel breakfasts i have ever had!

Reviews.Title: “A very positive experience”
Reviews.Author: lerbd
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights there in November. Don't be misled by the initial outer appearance nor by the apparent distance from the centre. Inside all is spacious and stylish. Everyone is welcoming and most attentive, the service excellent. Our standard room was v. comfortable; the shower the best ever, as indeed was the magnificent buffet breakfast. Mention too should be made of the helpful concierges, Michael and Sebastian, who gave invaluable advice and 'insider tips' re. travel on public transport around and about. Finally, although some might disagree, it's worth emphasizing the convenience of the hotel's location - whether arriving from either airport or popping in and out from anywhere in Berlin - S.Bahn and tram stop opposite - you can be in Alexanderplatz in 10min. max. Almost forgot to mention the 'wellness area' - excellent saunas,jacuzzi, steam room and gym. There's also an excellent restaurant with some innovative cuisine

Reviews.Title: “what a great place - couldn't recommend it highly enough”
Reviews.Author: ehc1965
Reviews.Content: Really can't find a thing that I would even want to whinge about never mind complain from check in to check out it was a great experience. The staff (all of them without exception) were welcoming, knowledgable and were genuinely nice people that could inform you and were interested in you as a customer. The room was large and the bathroom and shower room fab - exceptionally clean and well maintained We paid for access to the lounge and found this a great place to enjoy a snack a beer and a chat (as well as get expert advice) after a days walking and we did a lot of walking (and quite a lot of beer!) - I would recommend this. The travel to and from the hotel is simple and you can get everywhere quite easily as the S-Bhan and the Tram/Bus is outside the door (to and from Tegal Airport I would suggest the bus and the the S Bhan 41) - we had the 3 day card and this made life easy - again get one at the airport. We were in Berlin for 3 nights with 2 full days - not nearly enough - you have to see the Pergamon Museum it is incredible and the Reichstag a must and we missed more than we saw and couldn't have been happier with the choice to where to stay - many thanks.

Reviews.Title: “Very Stylish Hotel in Great Location”
Reviews.Author: TonyGNCFC
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a stunning foyer. Staff hugely efficient, polite and friendly. Rooms very chic and stylish. Breakfast buffet excellent quality and variety. The conceirge was very helpful recommending methods of travel and restaurants. The hotel is by a train station which is a direct connection to Berlin Airport and by a tram station which takes you into Alexanderplatz from where you can exlpore the city centre. You will not be disappointed if you stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Excelent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: FranciscoTaira
Reviews.Content: Very good accomodation, modern architecture and design

Reviews.Title: “Very good choice.”
Reviews.Author: jwith2boys
Reviews.Content: This hotel is new, modern, and was a very nice stay for my 1 week stay in Berlin for business. The rooms are modern and clean... The wellness center was excellent, two saunas, whirlpool, outdoor patio, turkish steam, etc... There is not a lot around this hotel.. there is a stip mall across the street which doesn't look real attractive from the outside, but the little italian restaurant was a surprise inside, very good and charming. You will need to take the trolly or subway to get anywhere, but in my opinion it is much better to have the trolley and subway stop in front of the hotel (which it is) rather than a centrally located hotel without a stop close by. The tram takes you to Alexanderplaz - 15 min ride... Be careful - not all the trams go there, but most do..Just make sure you get on the proper numbered tram... it is very easy... Of course the subway is another option and very easy to navigate. The breakfast was excellent and included in room rate, but they do separate the cost and show it seperately on the invoice. This may be important to business travelers. All in all this was the nicest hotel I saw in Berlin and half the price of others! cannot complain !!

Reviews.Title: “An excellent and luxurius stay - very recommendable!”
Reviews.Author: Pernill
Reviews.Content: Excellent rooms, service, spa + wellness, breakfast and wonderful view over Berlin from both the Sky Bar and the Sky Café. The food was delicious and the prices were fair/okay - the staff was friendly and very helpful. All in all: a very nice and relaxing atmosphere - so if you go and visit: ENJOY your stay at Andels Hotel Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “lovely modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: holidaytimeaylesbury
Reviews.Content: modern hotel with good size rooms, really comfortable beds. The food was lovely, we had buffet style dinner and breakfast, no complaints. Transport outside the hotel takes you into the centre of Berlin, you can buy tickets at reception. There is a really good small Italian restaurant opposite the hotel, excellent value for money, very friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “A conference hotel - it is a little to far from the centre for leisure/ sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: CDM52
Reviews.Content: A modern clean comfortable hotel - food was good as well. We spent two nights there. It is a little to far from Alexanderplatz to be an easy sightseeing base.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish, cool and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: tonyw99
Reviews.Content: From outside the hotel looks like the usual concrete building although the green and blue perspex panels on part of it give a clue to its stylish interior. Stepping into the reception area is like stepping into the pages of a style magazine. The white walls and floor, the modern sculpture to the right, black and lime green rugs with black, minimalist armchairs, the sweeping glass window looking into the courtyard and the bizarre gold structure containing the offices. The check in was quick and efficient and the porter explained all we needed to know as he showed us to our room. Again, we were treated to something out of the pages of a modern style magazine. White walls, black and white carpet, lime green accents on the bed and a stylish bathroom with large wet room shower. We were disappointed that we had two single beds but as the gap between them was just 6 inches we just pushed them together, and they were very comfortable. The hotel's location isn't central but Alexanderplatz is just a short tram ride away and the S-Bahn station next to the hotel provided access to other areas of Berlin and, at the end of our stay, a fast ride to the airport. The hotel restaurants aren't anything to write home about but Berlin is full of great restaurants so we mostly ate out. We did eat in the Sky Bar one evening which provided a fabulous view of the city. The burgers we ate were excellent and the staff were friendly and helpful. Two criticisms - although we had wifi in our room (as we were on floor 6 - the business floor) it was charged extra and the red wine in the mini bar was possibly the worst red wine I have ever tasted. Do not under any circumstances drink it. But two minor points in an otherwise excellent trip.

Reviews.Title: “Andel's hotel Berlin for a perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: Emdi70
Reviews.Content: Ou first trip to Berlin ever. We stayed at the Andel's hotel Berlin on the Landsberger Allee, and we were dazzled by the ambiance and service. It's a 4 star hotel but you feel like it's only for the rich and famous! A perfect service and ever friendly personel. The rooms are outstanding, same for the breakfast buffet. The skybar is a must see, and the health spa offers everything you coul possibly want.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: ifbourg
Reviews.Content: The rooms of the hotel are comfortable and very clean. Breakfast is great and the staff is friendly and helpful.We liked that he bar on the terrace has a great view of the city. The hotel's location isn't in the city centre but transport system is nearby, frequent and easy so we had no problem in our transport. I didn't like that we had to pay for internet access!

Reviews.Title: “Modern, luxurious, professional.”
Reviews.Author: Girlinblack
Reviews.Content: We spent there 4 days as tourists and I have no complaints. The rooms are comfortable, hotel is clean in all respects, breakfast was excellent, service professional. In all departments there was plenty of helpfull staff with good language skills, always smiling and polite. They have a concierge desk and a little gift shop so they are well equipped for the tourist even the hotel is mostly for conference purposes. It is located nex to a tram stop on a line leading to the center so the location isn`t a problem. We can recommend the Sky bar - great view, really. Maybe only one thing - the moder design and style was too much for me, but it depends on everyone`s opinion. :-)

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Efficient, Friendly and Peacful”
Reviews.Author: cjsjmy007
Reviews.Content: Excellent transport connections. All the staff were very helpful and knowledgeable about how to get to attractions, shopping etc, and what to do. The room was spotless, and the breakfast spread was worth it. The spa area was nice and clean too. I would recommend staying there. Public transport with the tube and metro train from right out the front of the hotel. Nice duvets!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel: splendid staff”
Reviews.Author: Rachel50_10
Reviews.Content: While the hotel was a bit farther on foot than we expected from the Alexanderplatz, we then discovered that the tram (right outside the front door) gave access to just about everywhere one would want to visit. The hotel staff were really friendly and helpful; the facilities excellent. We would return here without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Sheere perfection”
Reviews.Author: translator_interpret
Reviews.Content: Great place, beautiful hotel, comfortable room, great breakfast, friendly staff

Reviews.Title: “Quite OK, but I personally prefer more classic style”
Reviews.Author: Robertomazowiecki
Reviews.Content: Spend 4 nights in Berlin for Conference this June in Andel's Hotel Berlin. Overall it was not bad, but in some aspects the hotel furnishing and equipment seemed to be like they try to keep it very modern looking, more than really functional. So it was not what I actually prefer. The rooms are equipped with a/c but it is possible to turn it off. It is possible to partially open the window and to fully open it upon signing some paper in the reception. First I received a room overlooking a busy road and it was quite loud all the time, day and nite, especially that I like to keep my window open in the summer. So I asked to for change and my next room was overlooking the patio - it was absolutely quiet. The rooms are equipped with minibar/fridge and a large TV, but itself they are not too big. The kingsized bed was comfortable, but some rooms have twin beds. The breakfast was a large buffet, good food and a large selection. But the service was not so good and I often had to look for the cofee myself if I didn't want to wait for ages. I have mixed feelings about the reception - when I arrived and they were preparing my room, they offerd me a voucher for a drink in their sky bar - and it was nice, especially that I didn't have to wait for too long. On the other hand, I booked for a late checkout and first they assured me this was available, but on my last day they said they were fully booked and I had to check out at noon anyway. Generally it was all acceptable, but not my style and I probably would not stay there again, especially that there are so many hotels in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Berlin Conferencing at it's best”
Reviews.Author: travelgirls79
Reviews.Content: The andel's Hotel in Berlin has a very nice Conference area - the room(s) are very bright with natural daylight which can be dimmed to different shades with built in shades - very accommodating to the main program. The lobby is large and bright and offers enough space for good breaks, the food was very nice, although there was too little coffee (it was underestimated how much would be consumed). The breakout rooms all offer natural daylight as well with views into the old Eastern Berlin. The Conference area is purpose build and a good fit for groups around 250 people. The Sky-Bar is an absolute highlight of the Hotel as it offers very nice Skyline views at night. Highly recommendable (even if only visiting for a drink instead of staying at the hotel). The rooms are good but some are not very spacious. It's smarter to pack light and bring a small suitcase. Breakfast and lunch buffets are large and plentyful. The location of the hotel is OK for a Conference Hotel as Alexanderplatz can be reached with public transport or taxi cabs within 10 minutes. The S-Bahn station unfortunately isn't very clean and doesn't give the best feeling (especially at night). Underground parking is available for 10 Euro per day and is quite useful as garage is connected directly to the Hotel. Overall this is a nice hotel to do business is - for leisure, I'd personally chose something more central.

Reviews.Title: “Quirky Decor/Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tyroneiii
Reviews.Content: This is a huge ultra modern hotel. The decor is a bit quirky and not to every taste but it is extremely comfortable. I had two twin beds which were a bit on the narrow side but very comfortable. The bathroom was amazing: well lit, huge and a terrific shower. The staff was very helpful. The one drawback is its location: it is on the eastern edge of downtown but once you have mastered Berlin's great public transport system it is not too much of a disadvantage. HIGHLY RECOMMENDED. GREAT VALUE.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel was almost perfect”
Reviews.Author: budapestireland
Reviews.Content: There were a few things about this hotel that stopped me from saying it was perfect . Firstly it was a little too far to walk anywhere however the tram was just outside so that was not a big problem.The food and the drink was very expensive and apart from fast food i could not see anywhere else to eat, but to have a much cheaper drink you can cross the street and there is a little Meican bar and it is really nice and friendly and it also does snacks did not have any but ,they serve them late.Back to the hotel it was really clean nice staff,rooms big enough wonderful shower,lovely t.v. but not many english channels,tea coffee machine in the room a wee bit mean with the milk.The breakfast was really good i could not complain about it.We were very lucky our room was very close to the lift iwould say it would be a bit of a trek otherwise .

Reviews.Title: “Cool Funky Hotel”
Reviews.Author: N_L0GiE
Reviews.Content: The hotel doesnt look that special from the outside but the inside is really great. the hudge lobby is really well designed with funky furniture and mac's for you to use free of charge. Our room was a really good size with one of the biggest beds I have ever slept in (very comfortable) The LG flatscreen with SkyTV was brilliant as I enjoyed relaxing watching the latest films after a long day exploring the city. The shower was brilliant as there were speakers in the bathroom and you could listen to MTV while showering. The only thing I would point out about the room was that the air-con only went down to 18 which was a little hot to sleep in but apart from that we both loved our room. I was a little worried about the location of this hotel as it seemed a little far out from the city centre on a map but the location is great. There is a tram and train station directly outside the front of the hotel and the trip into the city centre is short (around 10min) with a tram every few mintues. Public transport in Berlin is brilliant. Breakfast cannot be faulted as it was a massive spread. You had everything you could need there and more. Overall staying at this hotel was extremely enjoyable and I would recomend it to anyone visiting Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with extremely efficient staff”
Reviews.Author: Kelhut
Reviews.Content: We have just come back from 3 nights in Berlin. We loved the hotel, it was modern and contemporary with a lovely bathroom and really reasonably priced. The location did not bother us too much as we bought the 3 day Welcome card for 25 Euros which we used to get a train from the Airport direct to the hotel and then over the 3 days. The welcome card also offered discounts to museums, restaurants etc. We found the transport in Berlin brilliant and having the tram and S-Bahn next to the hotel was a bonus. The staff were excellent and as we checked out of our hotel on Thursday they informed us that there were no flights back to England due to the volcano in Iceland. They phoned round trying to find us a place on a bus or train and booked us the last 2 seats on a coach back to England. They even picked up our tickets. Thank you to Sebastian, Steven and the other young male member of concierge for organising this. They really went out of their way. We were very pleased to get back to England as we know if the hotel hadn't acted quickly for us we would still be there. We would definitely stay at Andels Hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “A hotel like a hotel should be!”
Reviews.Author: neok
Reviews.Content: Clean, very nice rooms, very efficient staff ,very good breakfast. The bed's are large and very comfortable. Nice design and the bar on the 15th floor is just great, with a great view (drinks at reasonable prices). If you travel by car you can park your car at the hotel. Public transport is just a few metres away, and you can buy the tickets at the reception - great service.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible hotel, value for money but definitly not in the center”
Reviews.Author: ioliesym
Reviews.Content: Me and my family (2 daughters) decided to go to Berlin to spend the easter holidays and after lots of research we decided to book at Andel's due to its low price and also because it was one of the few hotels that offered breakfast. Also we had read lots of positive reviews so we thought we'd give it a try. We arrived in an early flight, and even though in our reservation it was clarified to us that we would be given our rooms at 12.00-14.00 pm the staff was kind enough to give us both of our rooms at the time of our arrival (around 9 am). The lobby of the hotel is extremely spacious and furnished with modern comfy couches and tables. The ceiling was also quite modern and impressive. Generally it gave a nice first impression. We were escorted to our rooms by an extremely kind and polite young man who gave us all the necessary information about how the elevators,our rooms, the breakfast etc. The rooms were incredible as well. I can say that they looked exactly like the photographs in the site of the hotel. The beds were very comfy and they were both equipped with huge flat screen LG TVs. The bathroom had both a shower and a bath, it also had a feature which i loved, you could turn the TV volume up ,and listen to music while in the shower. The breakfast was also quite nice. It had everything from delicious bread, a large selection of fruit, cereal, eggs, bacon, lots of tea flavors as well as a nice decor . It was definitely excellent. Now, the only problems or negatives were its location and an unusual and unpleasant odour the lobby had every afternoon. The location is kind of remote, outside the center, so we had to buy a tram ticket everyday (14.90 euros since we were a group- this included everything from tram to s-bahn and u-bahn and buses). Luckily the hotel already had all of these in the lobby so we bought them from there. Now with the odour, it is kind of weird, but every afternoon when we came back from whenever we were, the lobby smelled really bad, and I don't know why. It was a bit like there was a sewage problem or something. However we didn't really mind about that since we didn't really spend time in the lobby. Also another problem was that the wireless fee was kind of expensive. It was 3 euro for each time you used it ,and for each additional hour it was also 3 euro. However, that problem was solved, since at the lobby there were 4 i-mac computers that you could use for free. Moreover, one night we decided to order room service , which was reasonably priced, but it wasn't that delicious to be honest. I didn't really like the food, nor the taste. However, the lady that served us was very helpful and polite, and again, the service was excellent. Another night, we decided to dine at the restaurant of the hotel on the 1st floor. The food was excellent, and honestly everything from taste to service and decoration were amazing. However, its prices were ridiculously expensive and we didn't even order full portions and we still paid 3 times the normal price we would pay at a normal restaurant. Generally, we really enjoyed our stay at andel's and we would strongly recommend it to anyone that wants the best "value for money" ,however, if you want to stay somewhere in the center, near shops and attractions, i wouldn't recommend this hotel. Generally an amazing choice. I will definitely stay there if i ever visit Berlin again !

Reviews.Title: “Very simple: terrific!”
Reviews.Author: Oscar_from_Denmark
Reviews.Content: I just came back from a short holyday in Berlin and spent 3 nights at the Andel's. We had problems finding the hotel but actually we quickly realize that there are a couple of trams that stop in front of the hotel and that makes life very, very easy! The room had a standard size (not big-not small) and it was very well equiped. (My favorite detail: a tv loudspeaker in the bathroom :-) (Another favorite detail: free internet at the lobby). Breakfast was the next best one I ever had and the restaurant where we had it was as stylish as the rest of the hotel. We had a 3 course meal at the hotel restaurant as it was included in the package. Another great experience. The hotel has spa and other facilities but I didn't tried them as Berlin was calling! Try this hotel and you will not be dissapointed. Best regards! Oscar

Reviews.Title: “The world needs more hotel's like this!!!”
Reviews.Author: ROMAAMOR
Reviews.Content: I'm just returned from a 4 nights stay at Andel's Hotel Berlin and I just can't believe the high quality of this beautyful hotel.I have stayed at the hotel Concorde berlin the last 10 times I have visit Berlin but this time I decided to try something new and I was really impressed by Andel's hotel.From the minute I walked in to this hotel I know that it was something special.Really friendly staff is ready to help you with anything you need.Really modern style hotel with and a good mix of business and holiday guests. I stayed in room 834 at the 8th. floor and the room was really amazing.Big size with a really nice and comfort bed.Sofa and table in front of the 40" flat TV.Also a nice working area and a good closet with coffea/tea facilities and a big roomsafe with labtop charger inside.The bathroom was also big size with big shower and bathtop. The breakfast is served in a beautyful restuarant and is of very high quality.There is everything you need to get a good start on your day. Very good garage for 10 € a night. Also the Imac computers in the hall is a really nice touch and only the wi-fi internet price is not good (3 € for one hour and you can't get under 1 hour so this is expensive if you only need 5 min. online!!!) I simply don't understand why internet wi-fi not is free at such a modern hotel (We are in year 2010) Another highlight is the amazing Skybar at the 14th. floor with a fantastic view of berlin and top service of amazing cocktails and other drinks. The location is not in the center but only 5-10 min. from the center and with trains right outside the hotel door every 5 to 10 min. transportation in not a problem. So my advise is to stay at this hotel if your trip is going to berlin.You can't get more value for your money at any hotel in Berlin.I simply can't wait to get back to this fantastic hotel. Thanks a lot Andel's hotel.This world needs more hotel's like this

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic city hotel”
Reviews.Author: Londonjaneb
Reviews.Content: We went to Berlin for the weekend - meeting up with my student daughter and her friends who stayed at the nearby hostel. In a rush we didn't have time to do much research. The Andels Hotel proved a real find. My main concern had been that the location didn't look very central. However, this was not a problem at all - frequent trams go straight into the centre from outside the hotel. So with this worry removed the hotel then had no disadvantages. It is sylish and well appointed. The staff are all concerned to make your visit enjoyable and help in any way required - we wanted to know how to get into town. The concierge explained all the options and sold us the tram tickets to get us started. The room was comfy, the breakfast good. We didn't eat at the restaurant but did enjoy cocktails in the 'sky bar' on the 14th floor with its panoramic views - and good range of cocktails. We looked round the spa and wished we had longer to enjoy the facilities. I'd like to go back when the weather is warmer for sightseeing and I'd have no hesitation in going back to this hotel - it is a big factor in my wish to re-visit Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “My favourite hotel in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: EricWaalwijk
Reviews.Content: The Andels is the best value for money hotel in Berlin. The room are very comfortable and modern, good service, good food (they should add fresh juices at breakfast), nice fitness and welness. Don't forget to visit the bar on the 14th floor, you have an amazing view over Berlin. The business launch is very comfortable. I have stayed in this hotel very often and can recomand it to everyone. Only one negative point, you have to pay for the parking garage. I'll be back! Eric A. The netherlands

Reviews.Title: “Typical Boutique Hotel: nice design, pathetic & arrogant service”
Reviews.Author: TokyoTraveler70
Reviews.Content: I have just stayed at Andel's 7 nights around NYE. I was attracted by the nice design shown on the pics and the competitive prices. However, I was very disappointed... - from day one, they tried to give me a regular room for the price of the deluxe room (much larger) that I booked. I realized it and demanded to be changed to the room I booked - one night, they had an "event" for some corporation who rented the lobby and the first floor...it didn't look like a hotel any more... At 00:30 I couldn't sleep, the walls in my room were vibrating so hard because of the tacky and extremely loud music that they were playing. I called reception and they told me (in a very arrogant way) that there was nothing they could do to stop it. I insisted...they made me understand that I was so selfish because only one person (me I assume) wanted to stop the entire "event". In the end, they offered me to change the room, which I refused in the middle of the night (with a little bit of common sense, they would have: 1. warned all the guests about their "event", 2. changed the rooms of those guests near the "event" space. Andel's Hotel have to decide if they want to be a night-club or a hotel (care about guests, calm environment...), they cannot be both. - location of the hotel is disappointing, in the middle of nowhere; each time you will need to try to get a cab (not always easy) or get multiple changes with public transport. Don't even think about walking. - the hotel design is very nice (furniture, bathroom,...), too bad all the rest is missing.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, funky hotel, 10 mins from Alexanderplatz”
Reviews.Author: Lizacatz
Reviews.Content: Just back from 4 nights over New Year at Andels Berlin. Absolutely no complaints at all about this modern, friendly hotel. Spacious, well appointed rooms (only improvement would be free Wifi). The breakfasts were amazing - wide choice and friendly staff. Don't miss the Sky bar on the 14th floor for great views over Berlin. We will be going back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Funky new hotel/panoramic views from great cocktail bar”
Reviews.Author: mattys13
Reviews.Content: The rooms were very nicely appointed; the bed was comfortable, and the bathroom was spacious and modern (nice stand-up shower with great water pressure and shower head). The breakfast buffet was elaborate and delicious, and the cocktail bar on the top floor made great martinis -- the views of Berlin were great. There was good access to trams, U-Bahn and S-Bahn trains, but we found it a bit far away by the end of the weekend. The trip from the hotel to Alexanderplatz was approximately 25 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “modern ,clean, friendly !”
Reviews.Author: kennedymcquaid
Reviews.Content: Three day stay 11th december to the 14 december, well what do we say, this must have been the most genuine friendly hotel we have ever stayed in, well priced, location wasn`t central but that didnt matter , tram right outside the door , 5 minutes and we were in the middle of the city, at nights the sky bar located on the 14th floor provided us with beautiful views of Berlin at night, the girls that staffed the bar were out going friendly and professional, food was always of a good standard, when back in Berlin again we will stay at andels, I would strongly recommend it you wouldn,t be disappointed

Reviews.Title: “Modern, Stylish Hotel, within easy reach of Alexanderplatzz”
Reviews.Author: malcie
Reviews.Content: This large modern hotel opened in March 2009. The decor is stylish but comfortable & the rooms are well equiped with aircon, lcd tv, dvd player (movies available for free I believe), room safe, kettle with tea & coffee, toiletries etc. Facilities in the bathroom are particularly impressive with a walk in shower as well as a bath. The hotel is also well served with eating & drinking facilites - there's a cafe/bar on the ground floor & a restaurant on the first floor which doubles as the breakfast room. In addition there's a cafe/bar on the 13th floor & a bar on the 14th, both of which have great views over East Berlin. We didn't eat in the hotel other than breakfast which was decent & had plenty of choice. The reception area is huge & has a small seating area plus the hotel also has a wellness centre & a couple of shops. In particular the staff deserve a mention - all were very friendly & very helpful. Transport in Berlin is very good & I recommend buying a Berlin Welcome card which comes in various configurations. We got the 5 day version which was 34.50 euros per person but very good value as it gives unlimited access to bus, tram, U-Bahn & train as far out of the city as Potsdam which is about a 45 minute train ride as well as discounts (up to 50%) on entry to a large number of tourist activities including museums, boat rides, bus tours etc. The hotel is well placed in terms of transport with a rail station & tram stop are right outside the hotel. Berlin doesn't exactly have "a centre" partly due to the previous east/.west split but we used the tram every day to get to Alexanderplatz which can be regarded as the centre of East Berlin & never had to wait more than 6 minutes for a tram. Berlin is a bustling interesting city. There is much to see & although there is a lot of re-building going on (presumably still the aftermath of the war) there is much to see of worth with interesting modern architecture cheek by jowl with grand older classic archicecture - eg Schloss Charlottenburg. I can thoroughly recommend this hotel. We stayed for 4 nights & consider 386 euros real value for money considering the facilities on offer. Prior to our visit I had read opinions that Berliners were rude. All I can say is, this didn't tally with our experience - everyone we came into contact with was very pleasant. I have no hesitation in recommending Berlin for a city break ;& I have absolutely no hesitation in recommending Andel's Hotel as a hotel. At this price & with these facilites, why would you want to stay anywhere else?

Reviews.Title: “Modern, nice hotel but out of the center”
Reviews.Author: HotelfanNetherlands
Reviews.Content: Definitely a 4 stars hotel with amazing rooms, very comfortable beds and nice bathrooms; spacious and clean. We loved the television with all sorts of free channels. Coffee and tea as well as bathrobes and slippers made our stay pleasant. Mini bar was a bit on the basic side. Problem was the location. This hotel is really out of the center. You have to take the S-Bahn every time you want to go somewhere and the Ring S-Bahn is not bringing you to the center directly. You need to change a couple of times. Nice for the first Advent was the fact that the S-Bahn ticket was valid as a day ticket, allowing us to go everywhere in the city. The bar at the last floor was OK, pricey,and nothing exceptional in terms of drinks. View was definitely something not to miss. Breakfast is really very good. I think away above average for my taste. My husband complained that there was not a cook to make his eggs as he wanted like in other Andels hotels. Coffee was not good either. A pitty given the good German coffee. Internet is not free and very expensive. I would definitely go back however, especially for a romantic weekend, if I don't need to get out of the hotel much.

Reviews.Title: “perfect city hotel!”
Reviews.Author: kated_13
Reviews.Content: we were there for two nights in october and just loved it! it is a very nice hotel and excellent value for money! rooms were very nicely decorated (contemporary style) and the bathrooms were absolutely spotless! it was more than we expected it to be! the breakfast was really great as well and don't miss the perfect sky bar! the location isn't as bad as some have described! we actually found the location quite convenient, as there is a tram passing right outside the hotel which leaves you in Alexanderplatz, and once you are there you only want to walk around to see everything! generally Berlin's transportation system is very effective and I believe no one should have problem getting around! just go and don't think over it twice!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: Lintzel52
Reviews.Content: Brilliant hotel with easy connections into the city. Tram and railway stations are on the doorstep. Breakfast was exceptional, staff always courteous and attentive. Wellness area was clean with abundance of fresh towels and gowns. Skybar had a briliant view across Berlin. Rooms were nicely decorated, shower was very good, perhaps more room for clothes would be useful if staying for longer than a weekend. Don't be put off by the rather dirty, third world walkway from the S/Bahn to the hotel. Perhaps the hotel could help with keeping this area cleaner. On the whole exceptional hotel would definitely return if the price was right.

Reviews.Title: “A fine design hotel with a terrible location !”
Reviews.Author: Maxiiie
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a Deluxe room for 4 days: It was a very big room wit a large Lcd-Tv, Dvd player, two design chairs, big closets , high ceiling ,... A very modern room But Beware : Next to one side of the hotel are 5 railways ( 3 Regio DB and 2 S-Bahn's ) There is a lot of noicenusance at night and at day ! The breakfast was OK but the service and the varietie of the breakfast was very poor ! The location of the hotel is not good : 15 minutes away from Alexanderplatz by tram ( S bahn , U bahn and tram station next to the hotel ) There are 4 free to ise iMac's + printer in the lobby and also free Dvd rent ! The skybar on the 14 th floor is very beautiful ! The service is also very good but the prices are very high ! 3 euro for a 0,2 cl cola ! The hotel would be better if it has a pool but the fitness is very good equipped with high tech machines ! It is open 24 h a day ! I recommend that you book a room directly on the hotels website because that's the cheapest way ! Regards, Max

Reviews.Title: “Best ever conference hotel”
Reviews.Author: SoftwareSalesGuy
Reviews.Content: I'm extremely jaded after years of staying at conference hotels and being subjected to the same indifferent service, facilities and food. I am also a true vegetarian so company dinners are usually a dismal experience. I was therefore very pleasantly surprised to get such good veggie food in a German hotel. The conference buffet lunches were imaginatively varied and salad wasn't my only option. The Spãtzle were particularly memorable. Jug coffeee had a nasty taste but very decent stuff could be had from bean to cup machines. Staff were everywhere but unobtrusive. Empty glasses and crockery disappeared as if by poltergeist. The final evening's dinner started with a diminutive green salad topped with an edible flower and wrapped in a large cucumber slice accompanied by some tiny smoked cheese cubes and a balsamic dressing. The main course was asparagus en croute with a delicate white sauce, a soft and tasty tomato quiche tartlet and some baby potatoes gently fried and halved. There were two other veggies on our table and we all agreed it was the best we had ever eaten at an event, The beef noisettes which our colleagues had were also all perfectly cooked, especially impressive considering the kitchen had to prepare and deliver it for 350 people. The rooms are very contemporary but the Austin Powers look didn't jar, Not a great deal of wardrobe space but you have a safe. Clothes irons had to be requested from reception but came promptly. The shower was good but a little lacking in flow, however these are all minor niggles. A particular delight was that the water from the bathroom sink tap was actually drinkable (I often wake up thirsty in the middle of the night and don't see why I should pay 5 euros to avoid dehydration) and the windows could be opened for non-conditioned air (unless your room is facing the busy main road). This is how it should be done - why can't other similarly priced hotels meet these standards?

Reviews.Title: “Nothing bad to say, all good”
Reviews.Author: fly_one_oh_one
Reviews.Content: It may be a little far out, but a frequent tram takes 10 mins to Alexandraplatz (cool east berlin square) another 10 min walk and you're in Musuem island. Cool hotel, decorated very funkily, great shower, great staff, good breakfast, great views from the top bar floor. This is a good hotel and reasonably priced! All good!

Reviews.Title: “Stylish, clean, good location and most importantly fantastic staff!”
Reviews.Author: JimmytravellerUk
Reviews.Content: I stayed for one night only last Sunday and wish it could have been longer! Extremely stylish, modern and clean property with large rooms including free TV channnels that you would normally pay for. The spa is a great place to relax in too and I would highly recommend a massage from the male therapist with the bald head, sorry I can't remember your name! He not only gave a great massage but also loads of useful health tips and it almost felt like a consultaiton with a homeopathic doctor! The staff are very friendly and it really does have a family feel for such a large hotel. I have worked in travel for over 10 years and this is my first Trip Advisor review which says it all!

Reviews.Title: “Stylish immaculate, excellent breakfast plus good position.”
Reviews.Author: glensy
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 days at Andel's. It is easily accesible from airport being right on the S bahn (Landsberger allee) and metro lines (M5). The room was very stylish and immaculately clean. The reception staff were friendly and helpful and the conceirge gave some excellent places to visit and good restaurant tips. Berlin travel cards,postage stamps can all be bought through the hotel. The buffet breakfast was excellent (all tastes catered for). We found travel to all areas easy and transport regular day and night. We didn't use the restaurant but the menus looked excellent and there is a roof cocktail bar which also seemed extremely popular. The hotel was quiet despite being on a main road with metro at the door. Our only problems were we had booked a non smoking room but were told on arrival none were available, with persistance a room was found. We booked through an online booking service and were horrified to find that the rate we had paid was vastly in excess of that which the hotel itself would offer. So I would advise booking direct with the hotel and ask for what special deals are on offer as well. Visit the friendly kebab house across the road for good value food and best vlue beer in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort and pleaure...”
Reviews.Author: Missmijau
Reviews.Content: Highclass service hotel. Large clean rooms, fantastic restaurant. Very close to station. Everything was just perfect. Thanks!!

Reviews.Title: “Modern design Hotel with great cocktail bar”
Reviews.Author: Bwthy
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very modern and clean, and is beautifully designed. The beds are very comfortable. The staff were friendly. We used the concierge service to organise travel cards and they were very helpful - they gave us advice on tram lines and trains, and provided us with travel maps. The hotel is not in the centre of Berlin, but is very accessible - the tram stops outside the hotel that takes you straight in to Alexanderplatz and there is also an overland train s-bahn stop next to it too, and an underground u-bahn stop. Breakfast was good, with a wide selection of breakfast options - hot food, continental, cereals, yoghurt, fruit etc. The bar is well worth a visit with an amazing view over Berlin, and serves nice cocktails. I would recommend visiting this if you are in the area, even if you do not stay at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, Fantastic Staff, Perfect City!”
Reviews.Author: SydneyTourist1
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Andel's Hotel in Berlin twice at the end of June and then again at the end of July. In total I stayed there for 5 nights. I was extremely impressed at this hotel and its perhaps one of the best hotels I have stayed at. The staff where very professional and friendly. Many people have commented on the location, it is very central to Alexanderplatz which acts as the hub to all parts of Berlin. You can hop on the M5 Tram (Hackescher Markt) and get off at Alexanderplatz, this is perhaps 5 or 10 minutes, so it still is very central despite the comments of other people. I would recommend going on the M5 all the way to Hackescher Markt as there are some really great restaurants and bars located in this area. It takes approx. 15 minutes on the tram (they call it a Metro in Berlin). I really liked how the hotel (despite its large size) it still maintains the feel of a small boutique designer hotel. I was amazed in a 300-plus room hotel that the reception can remember you by name, and even remember you after 3 weeks which was the case with me. The design aesthetic of this hotel is second to one. Absolutely perfect. I would definitely stay at the Andel's Hotel Berlin again and have recommended it to my friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and value for money”
Reviews.Author: jimuk530
Reviews.Content: Just back from a week in Berlin where we stayed at the Andels Hotel. We caught the train from Schonefeld airport and after one change over, we found ourselves outside the hotel. We also found a tram stop directly outside and this along with the underground and s bhan lines nearby, made this location bang on! We enjoy getting to grips with public transport and Berlin made it easy! The hotel itself is absolutely spotless! The reception area is so spaceous that it made a busy hotel seem quite quiet. The Sky Bar was awesome with breakfast being of a really good quality with extensive choice. The only issues were no drawers in your room for storage and the fact that they wanted to charge 20 euro's for the hire of bikes which remained chained outside the hotel for the duration of our stay after we had paid out a few hundred for our week, surely a deposit would be fine!!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous - should be much nearer the top of TA's ratings!”
Reviews.Author: jackiesouthwales
Reviews.Content: Those Americans - you'd have thought they'd be used to distances by now, wouldn't you?! Okay, this hotel is a bit out of the way - but Berlin has one of the most efficient transport systems in the world. Don't know what hoops Matt from San Francisco was jumping through, but we found getting there easy enough. Just take the S-bahn from the airport and change once. That’s all. Andel’s is right next to the station. We bought a four-day Berlin pass and went everywhere we wanted to go with no trouble at all. Just jump on the tram right opposite the hotel, ride to Alexanderplatz and then take the U-bahn everywhere else. It was a piece of cake. It’s a fab and funky hotel. From the moment you get in, the lovely staff go out of their way to make you feel welcome. The rooms are ultra-modern and spacious: large flat screen TV with radio channels that you can switch on in the bathroom; I loved listening to the Jazz channel while showering – really sets you up for the day. The gym is the largest hotel gym in Berlin (said the attendant, rather proudly) and the hotel rents out bikes for 20 Euros a day. It’s a brilliant city for cycling – lanes running right through it and motorists treating you with respect - and I think I did every single neighbourhood in around seven hours. One last thing: as has been previously said, the Sky Bar is worth a visit in its own right. The drinks are a little pricey – but that view of the Berlin skyline, especially as the sun is setting, is magical! We had an amazing rate with Hotels.com, giving us four nights for the price of three, which worked out at around £70 a night. You won’t get that with too many hotels this standard. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “A Delightful Experience”
Reviews.Author: bear1979
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Andel's Hotel in May, and had reserved two bedrooms. One for myself and my husband and the second room for my parents from Australia. From beginning to end we were welcomed by friendly and polite staff. We upgraded both rooms for 30 euro each and were pleasantly surprised with what this included. We had full access to the A-Lounge, which included complimentry drinks and Canapes and Continental Breakfast in the morning. The rooms were spacious, modern and very well decorated. The Sky Bar on the top floor of the hotel had lovely views over Berlin, a must to visit even if your not staying! The Tram stop is just outside the hotel, making it very easy to access all parts of Berlin city. I would throughly recommend this hotel to anyone.

HotelInfo.Name: Andel's Hotel Berlin
HotelInfo.Address: Landsberger Allee 106, 10369 Berlin, Germany
